Additional Responsibilities: • Provide oversight and input in the building of programs and processes that ensure best practices are developed within the health and safety group. • Understand and ensure that all Governmental and PTFI regulations, laws and procedures are followed and adhered to with regards to safe work practices and work areas. • Develop training systems for the mine rescue group and ensure that the mine rescue team has proper skills, training, tools and leadership. • Ensure adherence to standard PTFI safety programs. Fully participate in FRESH requirements and reporting programs. Further develop area specific safety programs or structures that address risks in critical working areas such as traffic control, adherence to SOPs, electrical safety, rigging, etc. • Develop and implement key performance metrics that accurately measure performance and encourage continued improvement in all work areas as they pertain to employee health and safety. • Review, develop, and implement training/education programs that are mandatory as required by the Government of Indonesia but also that advance employee understanding for improved safety performance. • Fully participate and progress succession plans that develop employees with high potential so that the organization continues to grow and develop. • Investigate, develop, and implement continuous improvement programs that encourage improved productivity, safety and efficiencies. • Review shortcomings in the UG SHE group to help move them from an administrative function to one that guides, coaches, corrects and improves safety systems for all work departments in the Underground Division. • Ensure records are properly recorded that comply with best practices and DEMR regulations. • Provide the leadership for the work group that allows subordinates to have clear direction and a sense of belonging and worth. • Develop and implement new communication vehicles that progress open dialogue between the OH&S group and Operations. • Mentor and coach employees in all levels of the department so that their skill sets are improved both technically and from a leadership standpoint. Develop Field Safety Officers to engage the workforce in correcting unsafe acts and not to focus only on unsafe conditions. • Develop, socialize, and implement the required actions of all staff that improve safety performance in their work areas. • Develop and implement the programs that bring cohesiveness to all divisional safety and health groups so that practices, organization and roles are similar and followed. • Provide the leadership for all divisional safety groups for continued improvement and combined efforts to change the safety culture at PTFI. • Assist in the identification of key risk area in each of the operations and provide the leadership to mitigate risks through accepted practices. • Provide oversight of key internal and external audits and determine which add value and improvement. • Advance the development and implementation of the FRESH systems. Qualifications • Bachelor’s degree in a technical field and a minimum of ten (10) years of experience in mining safety systems or combined experience in mine safety of fifteen (15) years of experience with increasing responsibilities. • Must have strong understanding of underground mining principles and concepts, and a work history in underground safety. • Proven experience in managing a large group of employees. • Experience in setting up technical reports, scheduling systems, running projects, and business management. • Technical background with experience in Safety & Health management. • Planning and budgeting skill. • Willingness to work in a team environment. • Strong computer skills. • High level communication and presentation skills. • Strong English skills, both oral and written. • Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills. • Highly proactive and achievement oriented. • Highly focused toward satisfying customer requirements. • Strong supervisory and leadership skills. • Ability to work in a culturally diversified workforce. • Fluent in English (oral and written) and willing to learn Bahasa. Criteria/Conditions • Copper Overseas Service Company ('COSCO') promotes a drug/ alcohol free work environment through the use of mandatory pre-employment drug testing and on-going random drug testing as per applicable Company Standards COSCO has reviewed the jobs at its various office and operating sites and determined that many of these jobs include tasks or duties that could affect the safety or health of the employees performing these tasks or others. Accordingly, the Company has designated the following positions as safety-sensitive: • Positions within COSCO which are held by employees who receive Safety Training; or • Positions within COSCO which are held by employees who operate equipment or motor vehicles in furtherance of performing their COSCO job duties, including operating motor vehicles while on Company business or travel (for this purpose “motor vehicles” includes Company owned or leased motor vehicles and personal motor vehicles used by employees in furtherance of Company business or while on Company travel) Benefits: Begin first day of employment • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance • Relocation assistance/Ex-Pat incentives COSCO is an equal opportunity employer Job Segment: Compliance, Risk Management, Electrical, Legal, Finance, Engineering

With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success. About Nickel West Nickel West is a fully integrated mine-to-market business. Our culture is rich with technical know-how, highly efficient and focused on innovation. The business employs over 2500 people from five operations across Western Australia comprising of nickel underground and open-cut mines, concentrators, a smelter and a refinery. We also have plans to expand our operations with new mines in the northern Goldfields and a large nickel sulphate plant in Kwinana. A member of the BHP Group, Nickel West is undergoing an exciting business transformation to become a globally significant supplier of battery materials to the electric vehicle market. Nickel West will soon become the world’s largest producer of Nickel Sulphate, a key ingredient in lithium-ion batteries. As the world’s largest producer of nickel briquettes and nickel powder, Nickel West is leading the new-energy revolution in Western Australia. Nickel West has an exciting future ahead. We invite you to join us at Nickel West as we seek to energise our future. About The Role As Senior Specialist Project Manager, you will assist to develop, manage and deliver capital projects in a brownfield environment, with the support of the Capital projects team. You will also be involved in operational system strategies and operational project / modifications. Reporting to the Superintendent Projects, this role will be FIFO from Perth on a 5:2/ 4:3 roster with flexible working arrangements on offer. Your Responsibilities Will Include • Leading project identification, selection and definition activities through Selection and Definition Phase Studies • Leading development of execution plans, including scope, estimates and • Management of change process with relevant operational stakeholders • Assisting and coordinating site logistics during the installation work • Supporting the development of the project’s business objectives and stakeholder requirements, underpinning execution • Management of projects in execution working with construction specialists • Identification and management of project risks in accordance with the Small Project Management Framework (SPMF) • Mentoring, developing and coaching a team of Project Engineers across all aspects of the project lifecycle About You The ideal applicant will have an engineering-based background (although not mandatory) or relevant experience in Project Management or come from a technical background (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) combined with demonstrated delivery of projects. A background in the mining or resources industry is advantageous. In Addition, You Will Possess The Following Skills • An overriding commitment to health, safety and environmental responsibilities • A well-practiced understanding of the key elements of project management • Demonstrated experience in leading a team of project professionals (project engineers, controllers and construction personnel) in a brownfield environment • Demonstrated experience in managing a project with and without subordinates • Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills • Demonstrated experience in working with multiple stakeholders • Knowledge of design requirements and standards and scope development in a brownfield environment • Sound knowledge of WA Mines and Workplace Health and Safety Regulations • Engineering working knowledge in dealing with multi-discipline projects • Well-developed projects process and financial competencies in order to effectively promote and guide project value propositions About Our Process At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks. Supporting a Diverse Workforce The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a unique BHP employee share program. At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from women and Indigenous people. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.

Purpose Of The Position The role of business in the twenty-first century has changed and the expectations of stakeholders such as communities, civil society, business partners or investors are raising expectations. Companies must obtain and maintain legal as well as social authorization to operate by responding to these requests. As such Eramet has decided that all of its mining and mine related business across the world would eventually enter an IRMA (Initiative for Responsible Mining Assurance) certification process. Which in the case of Eramet operations in Indonesia implies that, in agreement with its partner Tsingshan, it wishes to have PT WBN and PT EHN (project Sonic Bay) become IRMA certified In this context the Responsible Mining Manager / IRMA will be responsible : • to have the Eramet related entities (and potentially others also operating on site) to formally engage into an IRMA certification process: • To engage with IRMA to register the companies within IRMA and launch the process in coordination and cooperation with IRMA • To train and coach the IWIP teams to the IRMA standards and requirements to drive the change in Environment and ESG practices on Halmahera site within the IWIP (Indonesia WedaBay Industrial Park) framework, • To obtain IRMA as per the agreed with IWIP and Eramet timeline. • To support and sponsor best practises in Environment and ESG related to IRMA. Responsibilities • She/he is the guarantor of compliance with IRMA standards. • He/she manages the environmental and ESG studies related to IRMA. Required As part of her/his missions, the IRMA Project Manager will be required to, in coordination with the Environment and CSR managers of WBN mine and of IWIP (as the case may be) • Ensure the implementation of regulatory obligations and guarantee the robustness of ESG risk control approaches; • Ensure the integration of environmental and ESG factors at the highest level in projects and industrial practices with a view to obtaining permits, financing, and international acceptability; in particular, deploy the IRMA standard’s environmental and ESG chapters. • Guarantee the integration of ERAMET’s best practices and the IRMA standard’s ESG chapters in line with the timing of operations or projects (WBN & SNB in priority). • Promote / lobby for ERAMET’s best practices and the IRMA standards as a reference in mining in Indonesia, so that they can be integrated into ESG regulatory obligations. • Carry out the project management of ESG studies and manage the implementation of the environmental and social impact management plan as per IRMA requirements. • Manage the monitoring/evaluation reports of all ESG actions, integrating regulatory indicators, and indicators set up with Eramet, and all related with self-assessment IRMA. • Assist the management and teams of the subsidiaries to create and implement the local and global roadmaps for IRMA achievement. About You Requested skills include: • Graduated level specialized in Environment / Environmental Law or CSR or similar. • Proven experience of minimum 10 years in permitting practice and operating rights in Indonesia or similar countries on complex industrial sites, preferably within large industrial projects • First experience in IRMA, either in its implementation or its audit on another mining site • Knowledge of the challenges and impacts of the Mining & Metallurgy extractive sector. • Strong belief in the environment and sustainable development • Experience in dialogue with Indonesian environmental authorities a plus • Preferably expatriate (but experienced Indonesian professionals fitting other requirements would also be considered) with fluent English (speaking and writing), preferably able to speak in Bahasa / notions of Mandarin Chinese would be a nice addition (not a requirement) Desirable Skills Include • Conviction and influence • Analysis and formalization of the need • Organization and decision-making • Ability to build and share a strategy • Project and matrix environment work experience • Strong communication and presentation skills • Logical and analytical thinking skills • “Hand on” personality with passion for finding practical solutions and excellent relationship skills HSE Capability Demonstrate a visible and active commitment to: • personal well-being. • healthy and safe workplaces and activities; and • continuously improve Eramet health, safety and environmental performance. With operations on five continents and employees from more than 66 different countries, Eramet is an inherently diverse group. We are convinced that this diversity of talents and skills is an asset and we are actively engaged in recruiting the talented people who will be crucial to our success in the future, regardless of their gender, disability, age, social or cultural origin or sexual orientation. We are committed to offering all employees the support and development opportunities they need throughout their careers.

job_title: Smelter Operation Readiness - Superintendent End User Computing
job_description: The purpose of this position is: The Superintendent End User Computing will be responsible for managing a team of end user computing support technicians to ensure the smooth operation and maintenance of all end user IT resources for our smelting and refining businesses. The position will oversee the day-to-day operations of the team, ensuring that they are providing timely and effective support for computer applications, desktops, laptops, printers, copiers, projectors, audio visual equipment, mobile devices, and video conferencing facilities. This supervisory position is to ensure that end-users have access to the IT resources and technical support they need to perform their job functions, and to ensure that the end user support team is meeting the organizations standards, goals, and objectives. The key duties and responsibilities of this position are: • Manage and oversee the computer support operations for our smelting and refining businesses, ensuring that all tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner. • Provide technical assistance and support to our employees in the use of computer systems and software applications. • Install, configure, and maintain desktop hardware and software including operating systems, office applications and specialized software used within process control industries. • Troubleshoot and resolve computer hardware and software issues. • Manage inventory of end user computers and peripherals, and software licenses. • Monitor and maintain the security of our computers systems and network. • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of computer related issues and resolutions in accordance with ITSM standards. • Collaborate with other IT teams to ensure that all systems are integrated and working together seamlessly. • Participate in the development and implementation of IT projects related to end user computing. • Monitor and analyze end user support metrics to identify areas for improvement. • Recruiting, training and mentor new and existing end user support technicians and evaluating the performance of support technicians. • Budget planning, cost control, and IT asset lifecycle management. The key challenges in this position include: • Managing a Team: One of the biggest challenges will be managing a team of end user support technicians, including subordinates from various ethnicities, religions, and cultures, to maximize their full potential. This includes hiring, training, coaching and performance management. • Meeting Service Level Agreements: Responsible for ensuring that your team meets the service level agreements set by the organization. This requires effective communication with other departments and stakeholder to ensure that service expectations are met. • Keeping up with Technology: End user support technology is constantly evolving, and it can be challenging to keep up with the latest trends and best practices. It is important to stay up to date with industry trends and advancement to ensure that the team is providing the best possible support. This means you need to invest time and resources in continuous learning and development. • Prioritizing Tasks: This supervisory position will need to prioritize tasks and delegate responsibilities to ensure that all issues are addressed in a timely and efficient manner. You man on occasions need to prioritize urgent issues and handle conflicting demands from different stakeholders. • Resolving Complex and Technical Issues: This role will be responsible for handling complex technical issues that the team may not be able to resolve on their own. This requires a strong technical background and the ability to troubleshoot and solve problems quickly. • Managing Customer Expectations: Customers may have high expectations with the resources and capabilities of the team. Effective communication and managing expectations can help mitigate these challenges. • Hazardous Environment: Smelting operations can be dangerous, the end user computing supervisor must be aware of and follow strict safety protocols when visiting and working in these environments, using specialized protective gear to ensure safety. • High Pressure Environment: Mining and smelting operations are often high-pressure environments where downtime can result in significant financial losses, and as a supervisor, you may need to deal with high-pressure situations where time is of the essence. You need to be able to make quick decisions and take appropriate actions to resolve issues promptly. • Staff Retention: In remote locations, attracting and retaining skilled staff can be a challenge. This supervisory position must create an environment that fosters a positive workplace culture and provides opportunities for professional growth and development to retain staff. The background, education, and work experience needed to succeed in this job are: Minimum Education & Experience • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field. • 5+ Years of experience in end user computer support including at least 2 years in a supervisory role. Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills & Characters) • Strong technical skills in Windows and Unix based operating systems, Microsoft Office, and desktop hardware. • Experience in managing and mentoring a team of support technicians. • Excellent communication and leadership skills. • Proficiency in spoken and written English, technical and conversational. • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously. • Ability to work independently and in a team environment. • Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations in the metal processing industry. • Experience in mining or process automation industries is a plus. The key areas in which you have decision-making responsibility are: • Managing Staff: Making decision regarding staffing, training and performance management and the allocation of resource and delegation of tasks. • Resource Allocation: Required to make decisions about the allocation of resources, including personnel, equipment, and budget, to ensure that the technical support team has the necessary resources to meet the needs of the end users. • Incident Management: Prioritizing incidents based on severity and impact, assigning incidents to support staff, and ensuring that incidents are resolved within agreed-upon service level agreements. • Procurement: Making decision regarding the procurement of hardware, software, and other equipment necessary for the smooth functioning of the end user support team. • Vendor Management: Make decisions about the selection and management of external vendors that provide technical support services. This includes negotiating contracts, managing vendor relationships, and ensuring that vendors meet service level agreements. • Technology Upgrades: Make decisions about when and how to upgrade hardware and software. This includes assessing the impact of upgrades on end-users and control systems, developing upgrade plans, and coordinating the implementation of upgrades with other teams within the organization. • Evaluating New Technologies: Evaluate new technologies and tools that can improve the support services provided by the team. This includes evaluating new software applications, hardware and other technologies that can enhance the user experience. • Continuous Improvement: Continually evaluate the effectiveness of support service and make decision to improve processes, procedures, and training programs to enhance the quality of support provided to end users. • Budgeting: Manage the budget allocated for the end user support team, ensuring that it is being used efficiently and effectively. This includes monitoring expenses and forecasting future needs to ensure that the team has the resources it needs to deliver high quality support services. Dimensions Financial • Approvals: Review end user requests for hardware and software and approving or rejecting these requests by determining business need and aligning with company policies. • Repair or Replace: Making decisions as to if repairing or replacing an end user device would be the most cost-effective long term. • Budgeting: Will be responsible for developing and managing an annual operating budget of approximately US$ 2 MM. Managing the budget for the team, including allocating resources for hardware, software, and other technical needs. • Cost Control: Will be responsible for controlling costs associated with end user support, including identifying areas for cost savings, and negotiating vendor support contracts. • ROI Analysis: Required to perform return of investment (ROI) analysis to determine the financial impact or support initiatives or projects as well as make decisions on repair vs. replace. Non-Financial • Maintain: The supervisor must manage the lifecycle of end user computing assets comprising one thousand computers, one hundred printers/copiers, over one hundred office and process control applications. • Leadership: The supervisor is responsible for leading the team and ensuring that they are working effectively and efficiently. This includes setting expectations, providing guidance, and motivating team members. • Customer Satisfaction: The supervisor must ensure that their team is meeting the needs of the organizations one thousand end users, spread across several geographic locations, including users working remotely and resolving technical issues in a timely and effective manner. • Performance Management: The supervisor will be responsible for evaluating the performance of their four direct reports, providing feedback, and identifying areas for improvement. • Process Improvement: The supervisor should be able to identify opportunities for process improvement and develop strategies for implementing changes that will increase efficiency and effectiveness. Dateline: 27 Mei 2023

job_title: Internal Control & Risk Management Officer - ICRMO
job_description: Purpose of the Position The Internal Control & Risk Management Officer (ICRMO) position is about to support and advise both the Management Committee and Operations Management of the entity to improve the efficiency and maturity of the internal control processes. In Risk Management, the ICRMO contributes to safeguarding the assets and achieving operational and strategic objectives. The ICRMO applies the Group methodology for identifying, prioritising, dealing with and controlling high-stakes strategic, financial, operational and compliance risks to which the subsidiary is exposed. Considering changes in the economic and operational environment, ICRMO assists the organisation in developing and monitoring action plans to control and mitigate risks. Main objective of the position The Group operates in a constantly evolving economic and operational environment and is therefore exposed to risks that must be identified and managed to a level that the Group's senior management finds acceptable. For several years, the Group has been engaged in a risk management process to identify risks, their likelihood and impact, as well as defining the level of risk monitoring required. This should lead to improved decision making on how to improve long-term performance and exploit opportunities. In accordance with the Eramet Risk Management Plan, the aim of the internal control system is to guarantee, based on the main risks encountered, compliance with laws and regulations, the application of the instructions and directives issued by the Executive Committee, the correct functioning of the internal processes of the Group and its subsidiaries and the reliability of financial information. More broadly, Risk Management contributes to managing the Group's activities, ensuring the efficiency of its operations and the effective use of its resources, and helps to achieve its objectives. The local ICRMO is thus an actor committed to improving risk management and the efficiency and maturity of processes. ICRMO also ensures a robust internal control system that reflects developments in the organisation's economic and operational environment. Main Missions ICRMO's main tasks include two aspects of controlling risks to which the Group is exposed: • Risk Management activities • Establish and update the organisation's risk map: • Identify risk owners and conduct risk identification interviews • Perform risk and root cause analysis • Evaluate risk impact and existing control measures • Assess current and target risk rating: impact, likelihood, level of control • Define and monitor mitigation plans: • Ensure consistency of internal control and audit action plans • Apply the Eramet Risk Management methodology and promote a risk management culture within the organisation • Use Eramet risk management tools (e.g. Erarisk Power BI) • Be an actor in the group Risk Management community • Internal control activities: • Rollout of Eramet Management System (EMS) framework in the entity: • Deploy and promote the EMS framework • Train the organisation to ensure understanding of the EMS standards • Informe the Internal Control Area Manager on compliance with EMS standards and of any implementation difficulties • Ensure alignment and complementarity of local procedures with EMS procedures • Implement Internal Control • Perform monthly controls according to schedule • Raise awareness of internal control issues within the organisation • Assist process owners establish action plans • Assist process owners monitor the implementation of the action plans • Support the entity with the Group Representation Letter • Participate in the use of data analytics and in automation of controls. • Liaise with Internal Audit during audit engagements • Coordinate with Statutory Auditors during audits and interim missions • Participate in the internal control and best practice community Scope, Dimension, & Complexity of the Position Scope And Dimension • Business units, entities, sites and projects • Working with subsidiary and site management • Direct management of one employee depending on the size of the site Complexity • Rigour, method, responsiveness • Soft skills needed to build relationships with internal control stakeholders • Empathy and good will, while maintaining a firm commitment to the principles of Internal Control: • Ability to communicate with all employees, regardless of hierarchical level or profession • Ability to strike a balance between a firm requirement and an incentive for the organisation to achieve compliance with the EMS standard and with external requirements • Uncompromising on standards and strong negotiating skills to persuade site or subsidiary management • The scope and exposure of the position demands a willingness to learn about a variety of subjects (Financial, Legal, IT, HR, Tax, etc.) and about our operations as well as the ability to react quickly, to grasp complexity and to analyse. It is important to be familiar with standards and regulations in all areas of the business. • Prioritising according to emergencies Requirements Training/skills: • 5 years of higher education • Knowledge of the Group, its businesses, its challenges, curiosity • Good at listening, but uncompromising in defending the Group's key actions and policies, • Strong interpersonal and cross-functional skills • Organisational knowledge and analytical skills • Able to communicate at all hierarchical levels (from Site Manager to operational staff) • Understand all issues of the company, • Pedagogical • Rigorous, methodical, organised, pragmatic and results-oriented • Drives change Experience • 5 to 8 years' professional experience in a financial (audit, control, management) or other function giving insight in most areas of the business • Successful experience in internal control or risk management Language • English • Geographical area language • French is a plus With operations on five continents and employees from more than 70 different countries, Eramet is an inherently diverse group. We are convinced that this diversity of talents and skills is an asset and we are actively engaged in recruiting the talented people who will be crucial to our success in the future, regardless of their gender, disability, age, social or cultural origin or sexual orientation. We are committed to offering all employees the support and development opportunities they need throughout their careers.

Job Description Job Overview: The Senior Quality Inspector uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external issues to improve the inspection discipline within McDermott. They will act as a resource for colleagues with less experience and share their conceptual and practical expertise related to the inspection discipline. The Senior Quality Inspector solves complex problems and uses discipline-specific knowledge to improve their products or services. The Senior Quality Inspector impacts a range of customer, operational, project, or service activities with the inspection team and other related teams and ensures that they work within the appropriate guidelines and policies. Responsibilities Key Tasks and Responsibilities: • Supervise Quality Control activities to determine product conformity to customer specifications through independent inspection and tests by the Project Quality Plan • Identify non-conformity for rectification and ensure final resolution • Direct, Supervise, and Participate in inspection activities to ensure product quality • Initiate Quality Planning for the project to ensure compliance the first time through proactive and preventive measures • Consult with the Project Quality Manager concerning prevention and appraisal resources and the effectiveness of the Project Quality Plan/Procedures necessary to achieve the product quality • Initiate evaluation for non-conforming items • Develop Project Quality Plans, inspection, and test plans in consultation with Project Quality Manager • Liaise with QC, Engineering and customer to ensure that Quality problems are addressed and technically resolved • Appraise product quality by the Project Quality Plan, Inspection & Test Plan and determine conformity and non-conformity • All inspection results need to be documented, and if non-conformity exists, documentation shall be raised to establish corrective action • Assess the workforce required during the project execution as per the schedule and the progress • Provide interpretation of applicable code specifications and customer requirements. Additional Responsibilities: • Provide oversight and input in the building of programs and processes that ensure best practices are developed within the health and safety group. • Understand and ensure that all Governmental and PTFI regulations, laws and procedures are followed and adhered to with regards to safe work practices and work areas. • Develop training systems for the mine rescue group and ensure that the mine rescue team has proper skills, training, tools and leadership. • Ensure adherence to standard PTFI safety programs. Fully participate in FRESH requirements and reporting programs. Further develop area specific safety programs or structures that address risks in critical working areas such as traffic control, adherence to SOPs, electrical safety, rigging, etc. • Develop and implement key performance metrics that accurately measure performance and encourage continued improvement in all work areas as they pertain to employee health and safety. • Review, develop, and implement training/education programs that are mandatory as required by the Government of Indonesia but also that advance employee understanding for improved safety performance. • Fully participate and progress succession plans that develop employees with high potential so that the organization continues to grow and develop. • Investigate, develop, and implement continuous improvement programs that encourage improved productivity, safety and efficiencies. • Review shortcomings in the UG SHE group to help move them from an administrative function to one that guides, coaches, corrects and improves safety systems for all work departments in the Underground Division. • Ensure records are properly recorded that comply with best practices and DEMR regulations. • Provide the leadership for the work group that allows subordinates to have clear direction and a sense of belonging and worth. • Develop and implement new communication vehicles that progress open dialogue between the OH&S group and Operations. • Mentor and coach employees in all levels of the department so that their skill sets are improved both technically and from a leadership standpoint. Develop Field Safety Officers to engage the workforce in correcting unsafe acts and not to focus only on unsafe conditions. • Develop, socialize, and implement the required actions of all staff that improve safety performance in their work areas. • Develop and implement the programs that bring cohesiveness to all divisional safety and health groups so that practices, organization and roles are similar and followed. • Provide the leadership for all divisional safety groups for continued improvement and combined efforts to change the safety culture at PTFI. • Assist in the identification of key risk area in each of the operations and provide the leadership to mitigate risks through accepted practices. • Provide oversight of key internal and external audits and determine which add value and improvement. • Advance the development and implementation of the FRESH systems. job_description: About BHP At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success. About Nickel West Nickel West is a fully integrated mine-to-market business. Our culture is rich with technical know-how, highly efficient and focused on innovation. The business employs over 2000 people from five operations across Western Australia comprising of nickel underground and open-cut mines, concentrators, a smelter and a refinery. Nickel West has an exciting future ahead. We invite you to join us at Nickel West as we seek to energize our future. About The Role Reporting to the Manager Engineering, this senior role leads a team to successfully deliver projects within Nickel West with a focus on customer expectations, HSE, processes, standards, quality and cost. Though supportive leadership you will drive performance and ongoing development of your team. This position can be offered from Perth, with travel to site as needed. In This Role You Will • Promote and coach operational discipline and high performance in work execution and enhance the technical knowledge of team members • Provide oversight and support to your team to successfully deliver on projects within Nickel West • Effectively engage with internal and external parties to ensure that pathways are provided for success • Provide inputs into plans, budgets, and targets for the projects and ensure delivery against them • Manage the planning, safe execution, and commissioning of packages according to agreed scope, budget, schedule, and relevant standards and specifications • Provide support and management to our contractors • Be first and foremost focused on creating a culture of care by being a visible safety leader, engaging, developing and coaching your team About You • Exceptional Leadership Skills • Strong Project Management experience preferred, but not essential • Demonstrated experience developing and leading a team focussed on continuous improvement and high-performance • Autonomous and confident work style • Influencing skills that effectively encourage collaboration between departments and groups • Demonstrate ability to prioritise and effectively manage multiple deliverables across stakeholders • Demonstrate the confidence to lead by example, hold yourself and others accountable and coach others in ‘Safety Leadership’ About Our Process At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks. If you are already employed directly by BHP, please log in using your BHP email address or apply via our internal jobs portal. Supporting a Diverse Workforce The size, stability and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a best-in-class employee share program. job_title: Head of Legal - Diversified Local Conglomerate - Jakarta Based
job_description: An innovative local business with a very diverse business sectors (energy, natural resources, property and technology) is looking to bring on board a seasoned Head of Legal / Legal Director who will be reporting to the C-level. As an Indonesian-based company, they have an ambitious mission to expand their footprints overseas, even beyond the SEA realm. Client Details An innovative local business with a very diverse business sectors (energy, natural resources, property and technology) is looking to bring on board a seasoned Head of Legal / Legal Director who will be reporting to the C-level. As an Indonesian-based company, they have an ambitious mission to expand their footprints overseas, even beyond the SEA realm. As a key client of ours, we have been witnessing their tremendous growth over the years, and they are one of the few clients which also have a genuine interest in the sustainability space. As such, the Head of Legal (or equivalent to director) is becoming a more critical hire. Description As the Head of Legal, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing all legal matters within an organization, and you will be sitting at the corporate/holding level, managing multiple business units that they own. Other key responsibilities include: • Strategic Operation: • Developing and implementing the organization's legal strategy to be aligned with the business focus. • Providing strategic legal advice to the executive team members and owners on strategic decisions. • Ensuring that all subsidiaries are in compliance with both the local and international standard, laws and regulations. • Staying up to date with with changes in relevant laws and regulations that will impact the organization. • Stakeholders Management/Leadership: • Lead and manage a team of at least 20 legal professionals, including attorneys and paralegals. • Providing guidance, mentorship and support to ensure the team's performance development. • Setting up objectives, and ensuring that the team's culture is being built on. • Working closely with other departmental leadership and other key stakeholders. • Expertise: • Identifying and managing legal risks, and developing strategies to mitigate potential liabilities. • Collaborating with external counsels when necessary. At times, you are expected to work closely with other professionals (investment bankers, foreign investments) • Providing advise to the executive team members and board of directors on corporate governance matters, and ensuring compliance with the corporate governance. • Conducting thorough legal due diligence on targeted companies - includes reviewing contracts, financial statements, litigation history - identifying any potential risks. • Handling cross-border trade, investments and understanding regulatory compliance outside Indonesia when required. • Providing advise in structuring, and negotiating international transactions, including merger & acquisitions, joint ventures, and strategic alliances. • Working in a team to provide legal considerations when establishing operations in foreign countries. Profile This role is only opened for Indonesians who can communicate well in Bahasa and English, and has the track record of managing a team of at least 15 team members. Other requirements: • University degree from reputable law school (Master from international university will be highly preferred). • Industry preference: law firms and in-house (experience in local diversified or relevant industries would be highly preferred. • Strong knowledge of international law, M&A, corporate governance and commercial law. • At least 12- 15 years of working experience in multi-national brands or reputable local companies. • Excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skill in both Bahasa and English. • Hands-on attitude and one with strong leadership skill. • Good personal skills, strategic thinking and excellent attention to detail is a must. Job Offer This role is the key hire for the group as they focus more on expansion, even outside Indonesia. Besides the opportunity to work in a very diverse business, and a local business, you will receive other opportunities such as: • Attractive renumeration which includes medical benefit. • Opportunity to build and strengthen the current legal team. • Working alongside with bright minds from diverse culture. • Be part of the key members to focus on the sustainability of the business. Desired Skills and Experience Legal, Lawyer, Corporate Lawyer, M&A, Disputes Resolution, Cross-Border Law, International Law, Capital Market, Due Diligence, Contract, Corporate Secretary, General Counsel, Energy, Mining, Property. To apply online please click the Apply button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Imeiniar Chandra on +62 21 2958 8832

Entity: Production & Operations Job Family Group: HSSE Group Job Summary: This is a global role and can be based in any location where there is a bp office. As a Labour Rights Supply Chain Advisor in the Production & Operations organization within the HSE & Carbon sub-entity at bp, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the company's dedication to human rights throughout its supply chain with an initial focus on labour rights. Job Description: Your expertise in workers’ rights and due diligence processes will contribute to the identification, evaluation, and mitigation of human rights risks associated with our contractors and suppliers. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and implement strategies that promote human rights, improve transparency, and drive responsible business practices across the supply chain Key Accountabilities: On behalf of the HSE&C Senior Vice President, and under the leadership of the E&S Labour Rights and Modern Slavery Manager, this role is to deliver the following activities (‘suppliers’ include suppliers of both goods and services): • Risk assessment: Help to develop systems (human and digital) to identify and evaluate potential human rights risks and impacts (with initial focus on labour rights) arising from supplier activities, such as forced labor, child labor, discrimination, and health and safety practices. • Compliance monitoring: Develop and implement monitoring systems to assess suppliers' compliance with human rights policies, procedures, and contractual obligations. • Conduct due diligence: Conduct comprehensive labour rights due diligence assessments (in-person and remote) of contractors and suppliers within the company's supply chain, utilizing internationally recognized frameworks and standards. Review reports of assessments carried out by other bp parties and provide feedback • Remedy: Collaborate with internal stakeholders and suppliers to develop and implement remedy to address identified human rights issues, ensuring effective resolution and continuous improvement. • Programme management: input into programme design and lead implementation of key programmes. Work with data systems to record and track progress. • Stakeholder engagement: Engage with relevant stakeholders, including internal businesses and central functions and external suppliers, to foster partnerships and exchange best practices in human rights due diligence. • Reporting and transparency: Prepare accurate and timely reports on human rights performance indicators, ensuring clarity and accountability within bp and in the supply chain. • Collaboration and coordination: Collaborate with internal teams, such as Legal, Procurement, and Sustainability, to integrate human rights considerations into the procurement and contracting processes. Essential Experience and Job Requirements: • Strong understanding of international human rights standards, frameworks, and guidelines, such as the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights and the International Labor Organization (ILO) conventions. Familiarity with the energy industry and supply chain dynamics is a plus. • Demonstrated ability in human rights, sourcing, supply chain management, or a related field. Experience in crafting supplier questionnaires, conducting due diligence assessments and/or facilitating remedy with suppliers is required. • Proven track record of engaging with diverse stakeholders to build relationships, address concerns, and promote collaboration. • Excellent data compilation and analytical skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey sophisticated concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. To take initiative and lead in solving problems without a high degree of supervision. Desireable Criteria: • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, meet deadlines, and work independently in a fast-paced environment. Strong organizational and time management skills. • Sensitivity to cultural and social contexts, with the ability to navigate diverse cultural environments and adapt approaches accordingly. • Multiple language skills would be a plus. Education: Bachelors degree in human rights, international relations, social sciences, law, supply chain or a related field or equivalent experience At bp, we provide the following environment & benefits: • A company culture where we respect our diverse teams and are proud of our achievements. • Possibility to join social communities and networks. • A healthy work-life balance. • Chill-out and collaboration spaces in a modern office environment. • Learning and development opportunities to craft your career path. • Life & health insurance, medical care package. • And many others benefits. Travel Requirement Up to 10% travel should be expected with this role Relocation Assistance: This role is not eligible for relocation Remote Type: This position is a hybrid of office/remote working Skills: Air quality management, Biodiversity management, Carbon Management, Chemical hazard management, Community Engagement, Environmental legal compliance, Environmental management, Environment and Social Group Reporting, Environment and Social Project Compliance Analysis, Human Rights, Labor Rights, Labour rights and modern slavery, Noise emissions management, Remediation Management, Social Impact Management, Social Sustainability, Supply Chain, Teamwork, Waste Management, Water Management Legal Disclaimer: We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. job_description: Title: Technical Expert, Aviation - PTFI Aviation Program Manager Requisition ID: 122902 Location: Papua, ID, 99967 Category: Aviation Description: The purpose of this position is focused on Aviation Program Management and oversight with the autonomy to shift across all facets of the PTFI Aviation enterprise. Manage, direct, control, monitor, support, and coordinate all aspects of aircraft (fixed, rotary, and Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS)) and airport operations within applicable safety standards and regulatory requirements. Continually explore opportunities to increase flight safety, operational efficiencies, and increased value of PTFI organic aviation provided by support contractors. Additional Responsibilities • Management and oversight of all facets of aviation and airport operations to ensure all processes and procedures are safe, efficient, and affordable. • Onsite Program Manager for all PTFI-based Aviation programs and initiatives. Develops, implements, and manages program workflow, GANTT, Agile, and other PM processes to ensure safe, efficient, and timely implementation. • Manages all aviation documentation and records IAW applicable standards. Provides site and corporate leadership with daily aviation operational update, as well as weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports as required. Responsible for data content, clarity, and archiving. • Manage, control, and oversee all aspects of airport operations to include ground support, maintenance support, fueling operations, ground support equipment, and airport facilities. • Manages and provides oversight for all aviation and airport training programs including pilot and loadmaster certifications and training requirements. Conducts informal audits & spot checks of airfield operations and aviation proficiency for all crewmembers using appropriate checklists. Responsible for program of instruction development/revision, standardization, training record management, and safety. • Coach, teacher, mentor, and advisor for contract Base Managers. Ensures Base Managers are held accountable to uphold and improve PTFI aviation standards and procedures. • Site subject matter expert on Aviation regulatory and safety requirements. Leads the site Aviation Safety Council and interfaces with local authorities to conduct periodic Air Operator and Airport Coordination Meetings. • Leads the site weekly Production Coordination (PC) Meeting to synchronize and coordinate all aviation resources to support mine site requirements. Forecasts and coordinates maintenance windows and oversees aircraft reliability program. Responsible for the optimization of helicopter & UAS resources based on aircraft capability and availability. • Supports AVCO Airfield Manager and Helipad-66 Support Team. Provides oversite to audit schedule for Air Traffic Control (ATC) and Airspace Management processes. Facilitates gap analysis and workflow vis-à-vis AVCO with AirNav as required to ensure safe and reliable operations. • Develops and leads pilot development program through weekly and monthly pilot briefings and tactics, techniques, and procedure refinement sessions. Leads a daily pilot brief that covers mission parameters, weather impacts, airspace deconfliction, personnel movements, and all safety mitigation parameters. • Acts as the on-site company representative and liaison for internal and external stakeholders. Interfaces with company senior leadership at site. Ensures all actions are coordinated, resourced, synchronized, and approved with on-site leadership and FCX Corporate Aviation Team. Responsible for being the champion of all Company Aviation/Airport policies and procedures including FMI Aviation Department guidelines. • Supports the development of on-site Aviation safety strategy to include internal and external audit program, the Baldwin Risk Mitigation Tool, and the Safety Dashboard. Reviews and approves all low-risk mission requirements. Develops suitable control measures to mitigate risk to lowest acceptable level. Primary conduit to secure medium and high-level risk mission approvals through the Freeport Corporate Aviation Department. • Able to conduct initial Aviation and UAS investigations when required. • Additional duties as required. Qualifications • Bachelor’s Degree with more than twelve (12) years of Aviation experience managing complex and multi-faceted operations in austere environments integrating ground and aviation support to achieve mission success. • Holds or has held an active pilot (fixed or rotary) license for greater than ten (10) years with commensurate aviation experience. • Robust experience with planning and safely executing all facets of Aviation operations in complex and austere environments including fixed-wing, rotary-wing, Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS), and airfield/airport operations. • Formally trained and experienced in Aviation Safety Management Systems and Risk Management procedures. • Program/Project Management experience. • Demonstrated leadership experience with diverse and multi-cultural teams/environments. • Strong direct supervisory experience. Ability to coach, teach, and mentor others. • Demonstrated ability to drive change and program/process improvement. • Demonstrated ability to identify root causes and provide effective/innovative solutions. • Ability to delegate appropriately and develop subordinates. • Ability to confidently represent the company at enterprise/site-specific stakeholder meetings, forums, and engagement opportunities. • Ability to operate safely and further department initiatives with minimal guidance. • Expert communicator – interpersonal, verbal, written and presentations. • Highly adept at evaluating outcomes and impacts of programs on current/planned operations. • Proven ability to assess risk and develop appropriate controls to mitigate. • Ability to develop strategy and execute plans. • Highly flexible and adaptable to change. • High level of ethics and integrity. • Skilled at assessing and developing a long-term perspective. • Expert at developing and maintaining relationships and diffusing situations. • Promotes best practices and appropriately questions processes to seek improvement. • Proficiency in using appropriate software suites (e.g. MS Office). • Fluent in English (oral and written) and willing to learn Bahasa. Preferred Qualifications • Post-graduate degree in Management, Business, or related field with more than fifteen (15) years of experience. • Holds or has held an active pilot (fixed or rotary) license for greater than twelve (12) years with commensurate aviation experience. • Possesses an FAA/CAA/DGCA (or commensurate) Part-107 certification for Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS). • Experience developing and communicating powerful presentations (complete, clear, and concise). Criteria/Conditions • Copper Overseas Service Company ('COSCO') promotes a drug/ alcohol free work environment through the use of mandatory pre-employment drug testing and on-going random drug testing as per applicable Company Standards COSCO has reviewed the jobs at its various office and operating sites and determined that many of these jobs include tasks or duties that could affect the safety or health of the employees performing these tasks or others. Accordingly, the Company has designated the following positions as safety-sensitive: • Positions within COSCO which are held by employees who receive Safety Training; or • Positions within COSCO which are held by employees who operate equipment or motor vehicles in furtherance of performing their COSCO job duties, including operating motor vehicles while on Company business or travel (for this purpose “motor vehicles” includes Company owned or leased motor vehicles and personal motor vehicles used by employees in furtherance of Company business or while on Company travel) Benefits: Begin first day of employment • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance • Relocation assistance/Ex-Pat incentives COSCO is an equal opportunity employer Job Segment: Aerial Operator, Information Technology, IT Manager, Testing, Aviation, Engineering, Technology

job_description: About Orica At Orica, it’s the power of our people that leads change and shapes our futures. Every day, all around the world, our people help mobilise vital resources essential to progress. Established in 1874, we have grown to become the world leader in mining and civil blasting with a diverse of team of more than 13,000 across the world. It’s an exciting time to join us – we are shaping the future of mining through digital and automated technologies, embracing new ways of thinking, pioneering innovation and reimagining the way we work. About The Role The Technical Specialist Engineer – WebGen will be responsible for Stewardship of WebGen™ during trials, implementation, and ongoing management of WebGen™ including site readiness auditing, change management, blasting, training, communication with customers, maintaining site hygiene and disciplined WebGen™ operations while ensuring delivery of measurable value to customers and sustainable revenue to Orica long term. This is an exciting opportunity to join the team who are shaping the future of the mining industry to be safer and more productive. Join us as we take the first steps on the wireless blasting revolution in Asia. What you will be doing • Adhering to & being proactive in site safety promotion • Developing Customer Technical Relationship • Project management of WebGen Trials • Customer needs and business development opportunity identification • Analysing blast measurements and assessing performance against a baseline • Preparation of differentiation product and services offerings • Managing product / service implementation projects • Developing case studies, Product application stewardship • Training and accrediting customers and other Orica personnel in Orica courses (WebGen™ User etc) • Products and systems • Training and mentoring for Blast Technicians • Operations personnel and Graduates What you will bring • Degree in Mining Engineering or related discipline • Good Blasting Knowledge • Well-developed understanding of mining processes and key drivers • Competent with general drill & blast designs • Competent in pre and post blast measurement and assessment techniques • Good communication skills • Good project management skills • Logical progression from Technical Services Engineer/Senior Engineer • Minimum 5+ years’ experience in the mineral resources industry, preferably through multiple sites and commodities • Project Management • Drill & blast execution experience • Ability to undertake complex blast designs and troubleshoot customer concerns • Able to risk assess different blasting approaches • Adept at using Orica software and tools • Certificate 4 in training and assessing or equivalent What we offer As part of a truly global company, you will have the ability to grow and learn in a diverse, collaborative culture. We foster relationships and learning through connected global and local teams, promote flexible and diverse career paths and support the development of your knowledge and skills. You will be paid a competitive salary, learn from talented individuals across multiple disciplines and be able to thrive in a safe workplace within a collaborative culture. Ignite your career at a place where your distinct potential can find its home. We respect and value all Orica promotes and fosters a culture of inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment everywhere we operate. We treat our people and applicants with fairness, dignity, and respect, getting the best of everyone’s contributions. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, nationality, age, military or veteran, marital or disability status.

job_title: Smelter Operation Readiness - Engineer Network and Radio Systems
job_description: The purpose of this position is: The Engineer Network and Radio Systems will be responsible for installing, monitoring, maintaining, configuring, upgrading, and supporting the organizations computer network with a focus on digital trunk two-way radios systems, including the infrastructure as well as the radio subscribers. This role will work closely with production, maintenance, and security teams, providing support and ensuring the successful operations of our network and two-way radio communication systems. This position will play a critical role in ensuring that the organizations two-way radio systems are designed, implemented, and maintained to meet business needs, while ensuring the security, reliability, performance, and regulatory compliance of the radio system and make important decisions to achieve these goals. The key duties and responsibilities of this position are: • Work closely with operations, maintenance, and security departments to understand their needs. • Collaborate with other engineers to ensure seamless integration of the two-way radios systems with other systems and networks. • Configure and tune two-way infrastructure as well as program handheld and base station subscribers. • Maintain the two-way radio systems to continuously meet the companys business requirements. • Monitor the two-way radios systems performance, capacity, and usage, including developing and implementing testing procedures to ensure the systems meet performance and quality standards. • Troubleshoot and resolve issues with two-way radio systems as they arise. • Provide technical support and training to end users as required. • Configure and maintain network hardware and software, including routers, switches, wireless access devices, network controllers, and virtual appliances. • Monitor network and two-way performance and troubleshoot network issues to ensure uptime and performance targets of 99.95% are meet. • Planning and executing network infrastructure upgrades, such as upgrading hardware, software and security protocols and ensure these upgrades are implemented in a timely and efficient manner. • Develop and maintain network and two-way radio documentation, including network diagrams, inventory lists and maintenance schedules. • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of network and radio related issues and resolutions in accordance with ITSM standards. The key challenges in this position include: • Keeping up with Technology: Two-way radio and networking technology is constantly evolving, and it can be challenging to keep up with the latest trends and best practices. It is important to stay up to date with industry trends and advancement to ensure that you have the skills and knowledge necessary to provide effective support. This means you need to invest time and resources in continuous learning and development. • Network Security: Ensuring two-way radio and network security is a critical task for engineers. As hackers become more sophisticated, protecting networks against cyber-attacks is becoming more challenging. You will need to stay up to date with the latest security threats and implement measures to prevent them. • Troubleshooting: Communication outages can be detrimental to safety as well as the business operations and profitability. You must be able to diagnose and troubleshoot issues quickly and effectively to minimize downtime. • Communication Skills: Need to have excellent communication skills to collaborate with other IT professionals, stakeholders, and end users. You must be able to explain complex technical issues in non-technical terms to ensure that everyone understands the problem and proposed solution. • Managing Customer Expectations: Customers may have high expectations with the resources and capabilities of the team. Effective communication and managing expectations can help mitigate these challenges. • Hazardous Environment: Smelting operations can be dangerous, you must be aware of and follow strict safety protocols when visiting and working in these environments, using specialized protective gear to ensure safety. • High Pressure Environment: Mining and smelting operations are often high-pressure environments where downtime can result in significant financial losses, you may need to deal with high-pressure situations where time is of the essence. You need to be able to make quick decisions and take appropriate actions to resolve issues promptly. The background, education, and work experience needed to succeed in this job are: Minimum Education & Experience • Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or related field. • 5+ Years of experience in implementing and supporting Motorola Digital Trunk Radio System. • Certification, Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) is a plus. Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills & Characters) • Strong knowledge of business network infrastructure and design including two-way radio system, telephone systems, digital trunk radio, network protocols, fiber optic / ethernet cabling standards and AC/DC power systems. • Strong knowledge and understanding of radio frequencies and propagation technics. • Strong knowledge of Department of KOMINFO regulations surrounding the importation, licensing, and use of RF devices. • Strong knowledge of network protocols and technologies such as TCP/IP, routing protocols, VLANS, VPNs and QoS. • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. • Ability to troubleshoot issues and provide technical support. • Proficiency in spoken and written English, technical and conversational. • Ability to work independently and in a team environment. • Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations in the metal processing industry. • Experience in mining or process automation industries is a plus. The key areas in which you have decision-making responsibility are: • Optimization of Radio System: Continuously work to optimize communication systems, ensuring that they are reliable, efficient, and meet the business needs. Optimize factors such as bandwidth, data rates, and signal strength/noise ratio to improve the overall performance of the system. • Documentation: Maintain detailed records of the design and testing of the communication systems. Preparing documents including specifications, user guides, test plans, system documentation. • Compliance: Ensure that the communication systems comply with government regulations and corporate standards, modifying systems and or applying for additional permits and license to ensure continuous compliance. • Collaborating: Working closely with other engineers, and stakeholders to ensure that the radio system meets the requirements of the operations. This may involve collaborating on design decisions, identifying, and resolving technical issues, and managing project timelines and budgets. • Selecting hardware and software components: Must choose the right hardware and software components for the radio system, based on factors such as performance, compatibility, scalability, security, and cost. Must evaluate and compare different options and make recommendations to management. • Troubleshooting two-way radio and network issues: When issues arise, must diagnose the problem, and find a solution quickly. Must make decisions to ensure that the network is up and running as soon as possible and minimize downtime and data loss. • Capacity planning: Must forecast the companys future two-way radio needs and make decisions about how to scale the radio system infrastructure to meet those needs. Must analyze traffic/call patterns, predict growth, and make recommendations for upgrades and expansions. Dimensions Financial • Approvals: Review end user requests for communication devices and peripherals and approving or rejecting these requests by determining business need and aligning with company policies and government regulations. • Repair or Replace: Making decisions as to if repairing or replacing a device would be the most cost-effective long term. • Cost Control: Will be responsible for controlling costs associated with network support, including identifying areas for cost savings. Non-Financial • Maintain: Manage the lifecycle of two-way radio infrastructure and subscriber assets comprising two distinct and separate radio systems, one for Smelter operations and the other for the Precious Metal Refinery (PMR). With a total of 1,00 radio users. • Customer Satisfaction: Meeting the needs of the organizations one thousand end users, spread across several geographic locations, including users working remotely and resolving technical issues in a timely and effective manner. Dateline: 27 may 2023

job_title: Smelter Operation Readiness - Engineer Systems Management
job_description: The purpose of this position is: The Engineer Systems Management will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, configuration, and reliable operations of servers, storage, backups, and disaster recovery environment, to ensure the efficient and uninterrupted operation of the compute environment, as well as to maintain the security and integrity of the data stored within.This position will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operating of the organizations server infrastructure, which is essential for maintaining productivity and keeping the business running smoothly. The key duties and responsibilities of this position are: • Ensure the reliable and secure operations of the data center, and to ensure that it meets the needs of the business. • Installation, maintenance and repair of data center hardware and software. • Backing up and restoring data to prevent loss in the case of system failure. • Managing user accounts, permissions, and access rights. • Patching, ensuring the environment is continuously updated and patched to remediate all known vulnerabilities and reducing the risk of zero-day attacks. • Executing server and storage infrastructure upgrades, such as upgrading hardware, software and ensuring these upgrades are implemented in a timely and efficient manner. • Managing data center security, ensuring that the data center is secure from unauthorized access or cyber-attacks. • Monitoring server and storage performance as well as event logs to identify any issues or potential problems and take steps to address them before they impact the business. • Ensuring compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements including Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) related to data retention, security, and privacy. • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of system related issues and resolutions in accordance with ITSM standards. • Collaborate with other IT teams to ensure that all systems are integrated and working together seamlessly. • Participate in the development and implementation of IT projects related to server and storage infrastructure. The key challenges in this position include: • Data Security: The metals industry relies heavily on data to make informed decisions. As a systems engineer, you will need to ensure that the servers and storage are secure from unauthorized access and that sensitive data is protected from cyber threats. • Equipment Maintenance: Server and storage systems requires frequent maintenance and repairs. As a systems engineer, you will need to coordinate with maintenance teams to ensure that equipment downtime is minimized, and server connectivity is restored as quickly as possible. • Capacity Planning: As the number of users and data grows, it is important to anticipate and plan for future capacity needs.
