job_description: The purpose of this position is: The Superintendent Systems Management will be responsible for managing a team of systems administrators overseeing the installation, maintenance, configuration, and reliable operation of servers, storage, backups, and disaster recovery environment, to ensure the efficient and uninterrupted operation of the compute environment, as well as to maintain the security and integrity of the data stored within. This position will oversee the day-to-day operations of the team, ensuring that the team is able to maintain and troubleshoot the business and process control compute environments, monitor the performance, and respond to technical issues in a timely and effective manner. This supervisory position is to ensure that the server infrastructure is secure, stable, operates effectively and efficiently, with minimal downtime and disruptions, so that the organization can rely on it to process, store and manage its critical data. The key duties and responsibilities of this position are: • Leading and supervising system administrators, overseeing the day-to-day operations of the data center, providing guidance and technical support to ensure that they are meeting their responsibilities effectively. • Monitoring server and storage performance as well as event logs to identify any issues or potential problems and take steps to address them before they impact the organization. • Managing the installation, maintenance and repair of data center hardware and software. • Implementing procedures for backup and disaster recovery to ensure the data centers operations can be restored in the event of a system failure or other catastrophic issue. • Manage user accounts, permissions, and access rights. • Ensuring compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements including Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) related to data retention, security, and privacy. • Patching, ensuring the Environment is continuously updated and patched to remediate all known vulnerabilities and reducing the risk of zero-day attacks. • Planning and implementing server and storage infrastructure upgrades, such as upgrading hardware, software and ensuring these upgrades are implemented in a timely and efficient manner. • Managing data center security, ensuring that the data center is secure from unauthorized access or cyber-attacks. • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of system related issues and resolutions in accordance with ITSM standards. • Collaborate with other IT teams to ensure that all systems are integrated and working together seamlessly. • Participate in the development and implementation of IT projects related to server and storage infrastructure. • Recruiting, training and mentoring new and existing system administrators and evaluating the performance of system administrators. • Budgeting and resource management, of the server administration team and ensure that resources are used effectively to support the organizations goals and objectives. The key challenges in this position include: • Managing a Team: One of the biggest challenges will be managing a team of system administrators, including subordinates from various ethnicities, religions, and cultures, to maximize their full potential, this includes hiring, training, coaching and performance management. This can be challenging, especially when dealing with conflicts and differing highly technical opinions. • Data Security: The metals industry relies heavily on data to make informed decisions. As a systems administrator supervisor, you will need to ensure that the servers and storage are secure from unauthorized access and that sensitive data is protected from cyber threats. • Equipment Maintenance: Server and storage systems requires frequent maintenance and repairs. As a systems administrator supervisor, you will need to coordinate with maintenance teams to ensure that equipment downtime is minimized, and server connectivity is restored as quickly as possible. • Meeting Service Level Agreements: Responsible for ensuring that your team meets the service level agreements set by the organization. This requires effective communication with other departments and stakeholders to ensure that service expectations are met. • Keeping up with Technological Advancements: Data center technology is constantly evolving, and it can be challenging to keep up with the latest trends and best practices. It is important to stay up to date with industry trends and advancement to ensure that the team is providing the best possible support. This means you need to invest time and resources in continuous learning and development. • Prioritizing Tasks: This supervisory position will need to prioritize tasks and delegate responsibilities to ensure that all issues are addressed in a timely and efficient manner. You will on occasion need to prioritize urgent issues and handle conflicting demands from different stakeholders. • Resolving Complex and Technical Issues: This role will be responsible for handling complex technical issues that the team may not be able to resolve on their own. This requires a strong technical background and the ability to troubleshoot and solve problems quickly. • Managing Customer Expectations: Customers may have high expectations with the resources and capabilities of the team. Effective communication and managing expectations can help mitigate these challenges. • Hazardous Environment: Smelting operations can be dangerous, the systems supervisor must be aware of and follow strict safety protocols when visiting and working in these environments, using specialized protective gear to ensure safety. • High Pressure Environment: Mining and smelting operations are often high-pressure environments where downtime can result in significant financial losses, and as a supervisor, you may need to deal with high-pressure situations where time is of the essence. You need to be able to make quick decisions and take appropriate actions to resolve issues promptly. • Ensuring Compliance with Regulations: There are numerous government regulations that govern the use and management of data. As a supervisor, you need to ensure that your team is following the regulations, including Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) and implementing appropriate security measures to protect the systems and sensitive data. • Staff Retention: In remote locations, attracting and retaining skilled staff can be a challenge. This supervisory position must create an environment that fosters a positive workplace culture and provides opportunities for professional growth and development to retain staff. The background, education, and work experience needed to succeed in this job are: Minimum Education & Experience • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field. • Certification, Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA) • Certification, VMware Certified Professional (VCP) • Certification, Nutanix Certified Professional (NCP) • 5+ Years of experience in systems administration management and at least 2 years in a supervisory role. Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills & Characters) • Strong technical skills in areas such as server and network administration, operating systems, databases, Active Directory, virtualization and security. • Automation, experience with scripting and automation tools to streamline repetitive tasks and increase efficiency. • Knowledge and understanding of process control and data acquisition systems. • Experience managing and maintaining a large business and or process control data center. • Knowledge of regulations that govern data retention and privacy including Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. • Excellent communication and leadership skills. • Proficiency in spoken and written English, technical and conversational. • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously. • Ability to work independently and in a team environment. • Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations in the metal processing industry. • Experience in mining or process automation industries is a plus. The key areas in which you have decision-making responsibility are: • Managing Staff: Making decision regarding staffing, training and performance management and the allocation of resource and delegation of tasks. • Resource Allocation: Required to make decisions about the allocation of resources, including personnel, equipment, and budget, for system maintenance, support, and expansion. • Performance Optimization: Monitoring system performance, identifying areas of weakness, and implementing strategies to optimize server performance. • Compute and Storage Capacity Planning and Management: Making decisions related to compute, memory and storage capacity, management, and data archiving. • Incident Management: Prioritizing incidents based on severity and impact, assigning incidents to support staff, and ensuring that incidents are resolved within agreed-upon service level agreements. • Procurement: Making decision regarding the procurement of hardware, software, and other equipment necessary for the smooth functioning of the data center. • Vendor Management: Make decisions about the selection and management of external vendors that provide technical support services. This includes negotiating contracts, managing vendor relationships, and ensuring that vendors meet service level agreements. • Technology Upgrades: Make decisions about when and how to upgrade hardware and software. This includes assessing the impact of upgrades on end-users and control systems, developing upgrade plans, and coordinating the implementation of upgrades with other teams within the organization. • Evaluating New Technologies: Evaluate new technologies and tools that can improve the support services provided by the team. This includes evaluating new software applications, hardware and other technologies that can enhance the user experience. • Continuous Improvement: Continually evaluate the effectiveness of support service and make decision to improve processes, procedures, and training programs to enhance the quality of support provided. • Budgeting: Manage the budget allocated for the data center, ensuring that it is being used efficiently and effectively. This includes monitoring expenses and forecasting future needs to ensure that the team has the resources it needs to deliver high quality support services. Dimensions Financial • Budgeting: Will be responsible for developing and managing an annual operating budget of approximately US$ 1 MM. Managing the budget for the team, including allocating resources for hardware, software, and other technical needs. • Repair or Replace: Making decisions as to if repairing or replacing a device would be the most cost-effective long term. • Cost Control: Will be responsible for controlling costs associated with the data center, including identifying areas for cost savings, and negotiating vendor support contracts. • ROI Analysis: Required to perform return of investment (ROI) analysis to determine the financial impact or support initiatives or projects as well as make decisions on repair vs. replace. Non-Financial • Maintain: The supervisor must manage the lifecycle of data center hardware and software assets as well as manage data retention. • Leadership: The supervisor is responsible for leading the team and ensuring that they are working effectively and efficiently. This includes setting expectations, providing guidance, and motivating team members. • Customer Satisfaction: The supervisor must ensure that their team is meeting the needs of the organizations one thousand end users, spread across several geographic locations, including users working remotely and resolving technical issues in a timely and effective manner. • Performance Management: The supervisor will be responsible for evaluating the performance of their direct and indirect reports, providing feedback, and identifying areas for improvement. • Process Improvement: The supervisor should be able to identify opportunities for process improvement and develop strategies for implementing changes that will increase efficiency and effectiveness. Dateline: 27 May 2023

Entity: Production & Operations Job Family Group: HSSE Group Job Summary: This is a global role and can be based in any location where there is a bp office. As a Labour Rights Supply Chain Advisor in the Production & Operations organization within the HSE & Carbon sub-entity at bp, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the company's dedication to human rights throughout its supply chain with an initial focus on labour rights. This role is open to candidates looking for a contracting position. Job Description: Your expertise in workers’ rights and due diligence processes will contribute to the identification, evaluation, and mitigation of human rights risks associated with our contractors and suppliers. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and implement strategies that promote human rights, improve transparency, and drive responsible business practices across the supply chain Key Accountabilities: On behalf of the HSE&C Senior Vice President, and under the leadership of the E&S Labour Rights and Modern Slavery Manager, this role is to deliver the following activities (‘suppliers’ include suppliers of both goods and services): • Risk assessment: Help to develop systems (human and digital) to identify and evaluate potential human rights risks and impacts (with initial focus on labour rights) arising from supplier activities, such as forced labor, child labor, discrimination, and health and safety practices. • Compliance monitoring: Develop and implement monitoring systems to assess suppliers' compliance with human rights policies, procedures, and contractual obligations. • Conduct due diligence: Conduct comprehensive labour rights due diligence assessments (in-person and remote) of contractors and suppliers within the company's supply chain, utilizing internationally recognized frameworks and standards. Review reports of assessments carried out by other bp parties and provide feedback • Remedy: Collaborate with internal stakeholders and suppliers to develop and implement remedy to address identified human rights issues, ensuring effective resolution and continuous improvement. • Programme management: input into programme design and lead implementation of key programmes. Work with data systems to record and track progress. • Stakeholder engagement: Engage with relevant stakeholders, including internal businesses and central functions and external suppliers, to foster partnerships and exchange best practices in human rights due diligence. • Reporting and transparency: Prepare accurate and timely reports on human rights performance indicators, ensuring clarity and accountability within bp and in the supply chain. • Collaboration and coordination: Collaborate with internal teams, such as Legal, Procurement, and Sustainability, to integrate human rights considerations into the procurement and contracting processes. Essential Experience and Job Requirements: • Strong understanding of international human rights standards, frameworks, and guidelines, such as the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights and the International Labor Organization (ILO) conventions. Familiarity with the energy industry and supply chain dynamics is a plus. • Demonstrated ability in human rights, sourcing, supply chain management, or a related field. Experience in crafting supplier questionnaires, conducting due diligence assessments and/or facilitating remedy with suppliers is required. • Proven track record of engaging with diverse stakeholders to build relationships, address concerns, and promote collaboration. • Excellent data compilation and analytical skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey sophisticated concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. The Hot Metals area includes: Flash Smelting Furnace (FSF), Flash Converting Furnace (FCF), Anode Furnace (AF), and Anode Casting.The Shift Supervisor will focus on daily operational tactics, ensure safe execution of tasks and optimize processes, working closely with internal leadership and the Technical Service team. The Shift Supervisor is also responsible for tactical coordination with several other Sections within the factory environment (Mechanical Maintenance, Electrical Maintenance, Process Control, etc.).This position will report to the relevant Section Manager for each area. Main Duties and responsibilities of this position: Occupational Safety and Environmental Aspects • Responsible for the safety of all team members under his supervision. Responsible for the safety of everyone who works in his control area. • Controlling the daily operations of the plant consistently meeting all environmental regulations and commitments. • Proactively lead the team to achieve production targets safely by implementing all relevant Safety and Environmental programs, including Fatal Risk management (FRM). • Provide safety briefings (safety talk) before starting work either for process members, maintenance or sub contractors (general labor). • Leading his team in identifying hazards, establishing risk controls, and ensuring the effective implementation of critical controls in the field. • Ensure team members follow the SOP for each job. The Shift Supervisor proactively evaluates SOPs and becomes a conduit for information if there are deficiencies in an SOP identified by their team members. • Contribute his skills to the multidisciplinary team in the application of risk controls that have been analyzed through HIRADC and Job Safety Analysis (JSA). • Check and assess work permits. Responsible for work permits that have been given to workers. • Contributing his skills in work accident investigation and root-cause analysis • Demonstrate the ability to interact positively with operators, mechanics, technicians, during field safety verification and take responsibility for stopping work if there is a hazard or damage that has not been controlled. • Make work shift reports, which include work safety and environmental aspects. • Patrol the factory area where there are maintenance or repair activities. • Check the completeness and feasibility of safety equipment for both personal and production units. • Together with the Team Leader, maintain the Cleanliness, Tidiness and Comfort of the work area at the Factory. Operational Tasks • Creating and fostering a culture within its organizational structure aligned with PTFI's core values (SINCERE, Freeport EDGE, etc.). • Leading the operational team working in shifts to achieve safe production and meticulously handling multiple issues within the entire Flash Smelting Furnace facility. Mastering the use of the Key Performance Indicator (KPI) system to manage and encourage operational team achievements. Proactively provide input to improve the KPI system to ensure alignment with operational business needs. • Provide feedback on performance to team members and provide corrective action if necessary. • Monitor daily process results through predefined metrics. Manage Team Leaders and Operators to guarantee product quantity and quality within specifications. • Factory patrol. • Encouraging cooperative efforts in the field between operations, maintenance and other departments for repairs if there is equipment damage. • Proactively provide feedback to superiors and the technical team to improve productivity, product quality, process stability and operational costs. • Provide reports on production shifts (shifts) to the ranks of internal leadership. • Fully support emergency recovery efforts. • Understand operating the control system in the control room (DCS) related to the area. • Collaborate with Process Engineers in developing effective operational strategies to achieve production targets (feed speed, feed type, production quality, etc.). • Provide Assessment of Employee Work Results in group shifts as an annual performance evaluation. During the detailed engineering, construction, operational readiness, commissioning phases • Support the implementation of new systems/procedures/processes and provide guidance, training, mentoring and support. • Familiar with design and engineering aspects in the assigned area. • Participate in several training programs as mandated for business needs. • Lead/participate in making troubleshooting manuals. • Provide or participate in the delivery of classroom training. • Involved in the planning and execution of pre-commissioning and commissioning activities in the appropriate scope and technical area. • Assist other Operational readiness efforts as needed. Main challenges in this position: • Process complexity, team leadership, time management, effective communication, shift work schedules, physical work in the field (fatigue management). Preferred Qualifications: Education, certification and experience: • SMA/SMK graduate and has more than 10 years experience in leading shift operational workers in chemical, metal or mineral processing plants. OR • Diploma (D-I, D-II, or D-III) in a technical field and more than 7 years experience in leading shift operational workers in chemical, metal, or mineral processing plants. OR • Bachelor degree (S1) in technical field and more than 5 years experience in leading shift operational workers in chemical, metal or mineral processing plants • Minimum Certified First Operational Supervisor (POP). Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities) • Operational and/or technical experience and knowledge of safe and efficient operations for the following: • Flash Smelting Furnace Area : Pneumatic Conveying, Steam dryer, Smelter, Waste Heat Boiler, Granulation, Electrostatic Precipitator, Brokk Machine, Slag Skimming, Matte Tapping, Slag Hauler Machine, Cooling Systems • Flash Converting Furnace Area : Dryer, Smelter, Waste Heat Boiler, Granulation, Electrostatic Precipitator, Brokk Machine, Blister Tapping • Anode Furnace & Casting Area : Furnace, Hot Metal Launder (Blister), Anode Casting Wheel, Forklift Operations, Shaft Furnace, Cooling Systems • Experience working in operations following standard integrated planning (operation/maintenance planning and scheduling) and routines. • Experience in safe practice for managing and handling high temperature processes and molten metals. • Proven experience in managing field operations workers, by creating and maintaining the right work culture i.e. discipline on safety, environment and pursuit of excellence. • Able to communicate in English (read, write and verbal) well. • Have persuasive skills to influence parties outside of direct supervision. • Experience with Indonesian regulations regarding Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) for appropriate mineral/metal processing. • Ability to develop and maintain awareness of occupational hazards and safety precautions. • Understanding of work using MS Office and other reporting systems. • Skilled in following the application of safety and hazard recognition. • Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing. Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills And Character) • Occupational safety as a core value. • Take initiative to get work done with minimum supervision. • Good conceptual thinking. • Integrity and loyalty. Adherence to company rules, procedures and practices. • Passion to work together. Naturally enjoy collaborating. • Persistent in the pursuit of excellence. • Have high technical communication skills. • High persuasion skills. Dateline : 30 June 2023

The Engineer, Network Management will be responsible for installing, monitoring, maintaining, configuring, upgrading, and supporting the organizations voice & data network. This role will work closely with production, maintenance, and IT security teams, providing support and ensuring the successful operations of PTFIs voice & data network. This position will play a critical role in ensuring that the organizations voice & data network are designed, implemented, and maintained to meet business needs, while ensuring the security, reliability, and performance of the network. The key duties and responsibilities of this position are: • Monitor and control the usage of LAN and WAN networks, both internal and external, to ensure their availability and optimal condition. • Maintain and operate LAN and WAN networks efficiently, ensuring minimal disruptions and maximizing uptime for uninterrupted services. • Analyze the available network systems and tools to monitor network performance and identify potential problems. • Identify and troubleshoot network issues, implementing appropriate solutions for repairs and fixes. • Prepare monthly reports on downtime evaluation, identifying potential problems and addressing them promptly. • Support and monitor voice communication systems operations, including diverse networking hardware and software, maintaining corporate standards for performance and reliability across multiple sites. • Minimize the impact of changes on network availability by effectively utilizing Departmental Change Management policies. • Analyze voice & data network performance using network management methodologies and techniques. • Support and monitor video conferencing systems, maintaining corporate standards for performance and reliability. • Perform troubleshooting in coordination with related parties (field technicians, Helpdesk officers, etc.) to identify root causes, resolve problems, and prevent recurring issues. • Perform device configuration and maintenance tasks in accordance with Department standards. • Produce voice & data network documentation in alignment with Departmental standards. The key challenges in this position include: • Keeping up with Technology: networking technology is constantly evolving, and it can be challenging to keep up with the latest trends and best practices. It is important to stay up to date with industry trends and advancement to ensure that you have the skills and knowledge necessary to provide effective support. This means you need to invest time and resources in continuous learning and development. • Network Security: Ensuring network security is a critical task for engineers. As hackers become more sophisticated, protecting networks against cyber-attacks is becoming more challenging. You will need to stay up to date with the latest security threats and implement measures to prevent them. • Troubleshooting: Communication outages can be detrimental to safety as well as the business operations and profitability. You must be able to diagnose and troubleshoot issues quickly and effectively to minimize downtime. • Communication Skills: Need to have excellent communication skills to collaborate with other IT professionals, stakeholders, and end users. You must be able to explain complex technical issues in non-technical terms to ensure that everyone understands the problem and proposed solution. • Managing Customer Expectations: Customers may have high expectations with the resources and capabilities of the team. Effective communication and managing expectations can help mitigate these challenges. • High Pressure Environment: Mining operations are often high-pressure environments where downtime can result in significant financial losses, you may need to deal with high-pressure situations where time is of the essence. You need to be able to make quick decisions and take appropriate actions to resolve issues promptly. The background, education, and work experience needed to succeed in this job are: Minimum Education & Experience • Bachelor's (S-1) degree in IT, Computer Science, Telecommunication, Electrical Engineering, or related fields, with a minimum of 3 years' experience in data networking. • D3 in a related field with 10 years of experience in data networking • Cisco Certification, Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) is a plus. Core Competencies (Knowledge, Skills & Characters) • Strong knowledge of data network infrastructure and design including wifi, telephone systems, network protocols, and fiber optic / ethernet cabling standards. • Strong knowledge of network protocols and technologies such as TCP/IP, routing protocols, VLANS, VPNs and QoS. • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. • Ability to troubleshoot issues and provide technical support. • Proficiency in spoken and written English, technical and conversational. • Ability to work independently and in a team environment. • Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations in mining industry. • Experience in mining or process automation industries is a plus. Dateline: July 1, 2023

Come and be a part of this success. About Nickel West Nickel West is a fully integrated mine-to-market business. Our culture is rich with technical know-how, highly efficient and focused on innovation. The business employs over 2500 people from five operations across Western Australia comprising of nickel underground and open-cut mines, concentrators, a smelter and a refinery. Entity: Production & Operations Job Family Group: HSSE Group Job Summary: Responsible for supporting environmental regulatory compliance and the delivery of regulatory activities, including inspections and reporting, utilising sound technical capabilities to provide day-to-day operational support and advice on environmental issues, acting as a subject matter expert. Job Description: bp has an ambition to be a net zero company by 2050 or sooner and has set a number of Aims to enable this ambition to be achieved. Reducing greenhouse gas emissions whilst delivering value for the company is crucial to deliver on the aims. The Carbon Advisor will be part of a team of carbon subject matter experts who provide carbon expertise to the bp businesses around the world to help them deliver emissions reductions, bring carbon into normal business decision making processes, and support the delivery of bp’s strategy. The Carbon Advisor’s key accountabilities are to: • Provide carbon subject matter expertise to the bp businesses to support their delivery and planning of activities in service of bp’s Net Zero Aims, with a particular focus on Aim 1, operational emissions reductions. • Support the businesses the Advisor is tagged to with the development of plans to drive reduction in operational emissions that are aligned with bp’s strategy. Support the implementation of these carbon plans by the businesses. • Share learning and Aims best practise on achieving emissions reductions and delivering on the Net Zero Aims by integrating people from across the business and processes. • Support the delivery of climate and carbon communication and training material in tagged businesses and wider bp alongside the broader Carbon team. • Coach businesses on greenhouse gas data reporting; verify data submissions by bp businesses. • Support the integration of people in different parts of bp who are working on activities that could come together and help the delivery of the Net Zero. The successful candidate will be either: • An Environmental professional with experience of environmental reporting, emissions reductions or energy efficiency work, and who has worked in operational and/or project delivery roles, or • An Engineer or Scientist who has some experience in identifying and/or delivering emissions reduction and energy efficiency opportunities, and who has a background in the operation and/or design of oil and gas production facilities, refineries, petrochemical sites or similar industrial settings. The successful candidate will have: • Proven track record working in one of the settings described above. • A passion for emissions reductions and a desire to support bp in its Net Zero Aims and helping the world get there. • A basic understanding of greenhouse gas reporting and forecasting methodologies, equipment and tools, regulatory requirements. • An understanding of the place of carbon and emissions reductions in the context of the energy industry, the energy transition and the Paris Agreement. • Excellent communication skills both face to face and in a remote working environment. • Excellent interpersonal and team working skills, able to work to support or to lead activities, and able to deploy different approaches to influence and engage with the work audience. • A proactive approach to work, able to work both autonomously and as part of a team Desirable criteria are: • Experience with the development and delivery or emissions reductions or energy efficiency plans for an operating oil and gas production facility, refinery, petrochemicals, manufacturing or other industrial site. • Experience working with regulatory bodies or in a regulated work environment. • Experience working with colleagues and third parties who are based in different countries. Education: Must have a university level degree (Bachelors or greater) or a postgraduate degree in an Engineering, a Science or an Environmental Science subject. Must be a member of the professional institution relevant to degree, a Chartered Environmentalist, or similar, or working towards one of these. At bp, we provide the following environment & benefits: • A company culture where we respect our diverse teams and are proud of our achievements. • Possibility to join social communities and networks. • A healthy work-life balance. • Chill-out and collaboration spaces in a modern office environment. • Learning and development opportunities to craft your career path. • Life & health insurance, medical care package. • And many others benefits. PURPOSE The Librarian supports the development of reading, writing and oral communication for all students and faculty, through the sourcing and coordination of literature and multi-media resources. This involves establishing a balanced resource collection with an array of authors and texts, as well as up to date technology supports, in cooperation with the Technology Coordinator. The Librarian will meet with grade level teams to assist with the purchase, ordering and organization of student and teacher literacy collections via effective planning that emphasizes the trans-disciplinary nature of learning. Where required, the Librarian will facilitate the implementation of effective teaching pedagogy and literacy strategies within classroom library visits. The Librarian promotes shared leadership and supports the school to model collaborative skills, and a positive ethos within the school and local community. Duties And Responsibilities The Librarian has the following responsibilities: 1. Ordering of literature resources for all levels of the school, for student, teacher and parent use. This is done in collaboration with faculty members using Destiny Title Wave Follett 2. Manage the Follet Destiny System and online Catalogue 3. Develop the library as a modern learning center-hub 4. Develop a E collection for the use of all stakeholders integrated with YPJ Learning platforms and systems 5. Establish an online research database to support inquiry ie Newsela 6. Day to day organization and management of the library, including the arrangement of the book collection and furniture, to provide a welcoming and attractive setting for reading and research, including bulletin boards and displays. 7. Staying abreast of library trends, award winning books and materials, and promoting library use and development within the school and community. 8. Ensuring that the maintenance of the library is well kept, reporting items that need to be repaired or replaced in a timely and efficient manner, and keeping safety issues in mind at all times. 9. Co-develop responsive learning strategies for individual students requiring intervention or enrichment in the area of literacy and research. 10. Keeping the book loaning records up to date and assisting students with the location of books and resources needed for class, during their library sessions. 11. Being flexible and available for students and teachers, reading to students during their weekly sessions, checking out books for all members of the school, assisting with research sessions as requested, and taking on the role of a teaching librarian. 12. Attend and participate in team planning meetings, as able, for upcoming units of inquiry. 13. Promoting the use of the library to the community, through special events and the sharing of new resources, decorations of holidays, etc. The Librarian will also be required to: 1. Be a positive face for the library and school, creating a welcoming presence 2. Be committed to upskilling himself/herself on library management and skills 3. Take initiative in developing, managing and promoting the library of the school 4. Collaborate with all members of the school community and take a service role. Minimum Requirements • Bachelor degree of Education or Library Science or equivalent • Appropriate credential[s] in Education and/or equivalent experience. • Capacity with English preferred • Experience in a Primary Years Programme (PYP) - Middle Years Programme (MYP) School and Library Services • Have Flexibility and Adaptability • Have Cultural sensitivity • Willing to adapt with the school's leave system which must refer to the school academic calendar • Willing to be placed in a remote area Dateline: July 1, 2023

job_title: YPJ Student Services and Welfare Teacher
job_description: Yayasan Pendidikan Jayawijaya [YPJ] is a school set over two campuses: Kuala Kencana and Tembagapura in Papua, Indonesia. The school provides an inclusive education for PT Freeport Indonesia [PTFI] employees. The student population has a diverse range of needs from various parts of the Indonesian archipelago. PURPOSE The Student Welfare and Support Services Teacher is responsible for the wellbeing of students. The Teacher has responsibility to develop student well-being and support services programs in line with YPJ Mission, Vision and Values. The Student Welfare and Support Services Teacher works collaboratively with all staff and leadership and models the values of the school to create a contemporary, safe, purposeful and inclusive learning environment. The Student Welfare and Support Services Teacher is responsible for the social and emotional well-being of students and a safe, equitable learning environment. The person works directly with the Student Services department to support students who are learning challenged. This scope includes social-emotional welfare, learning and language support. The Student Welfare and Support Services Teacher is supervised by the Student Services Coordinator and Head of Campus as outlined in the YPJ Organizational Chart. Duties And Responsibilities STUDENT SERVICES • Support the development of student welfare, student support and personal development programs in line with the vision and goals of YPJ in collaboration with the Student Services Coordinator • Model collaborative practice, shared leadership and effective decision-making • Think strategically to ensure school goals are achieved • Develop systems, structures and educational support programs which are responsive to student needs. • Work with the Learning Support team [and the ISOS counselor] to promote student well-being, health and wellness. • Develop response to intervention strategies in collaboration with Homeroom/Class teachers. • Develop and promote a restorative justice/restitution model of discipline that promotes student responsibility and the values of the school. • Maintain an effective referral system to support responsive teaching and learning • Use a data driven approach to support and guide the needs of students under Support Services case load • Use contemporary assessment frameworks to inform and guide the developmental and cognitive needs of students • Promote the Social Emotional Program Second Step • Support students in the development of Bahasa Indonesia to ensure access to the guaranteed and viable curriculum. • Provide Individual Learning Plans, Student Accommodation Plans and modified curriculum where appropriate. • Develop a model of Student Services Delivery that is contemporary and best suited to the needs of students. • Be actively involved in the placement and distribution of students in classes to ensure equity and demographic balance • Manage ILPs, SAPs and Intervention Plans. • Assist in Student Placement • Liaise and support Parents where truancy and social services are required. • Promote and action the YPJ Child Protection Policy including robust reporting procedures Communications • Build effective partnerships with parents to support their child through ongoing conferences and communication of Student Services documentation such as Individual Learning Plans • Liaise with medical services [Ed. Psychology, Counselors, Speech and Language pathologists, pediatricians and occupational therapists] to gain insight, inform Individual Learning Plans and source strategies to support students • Uses collaborative practices to promote shared goals and to build trust and cooperation across the community • Model effective use of the agreed system of communication within the YPJ schools. • Maintain accurate and confidential records and databases of all students on case load using adopted forms and information systems [i.e. ALMA] • Provide presentations to parents on Student and Parental support programs • Organizational Management • Promote YPJ Policies related to Child Protection, Admissions, Inclusion, Language Development, Bullying and digital citizenship • Undertake specialized training and coaching to sustain a high level of Student Services Provision [ie Special Education Needs in Asia SENIA Level 1 Certification]. • Provide Professional Development for teachers in Student Services • Action the Student Support Services Handbook and associated policies and procedures Qualifications And Experience • Bachelor of Education/Bachelor of Arts/Bachelor of Science. degree, or equivalent specializing in Student Services/Psychology/Counseling • A current teaching credential • Willingness to undertake specialized Student Services Training • Organizational ability, initiative, and effective communicative and interpersonal skills • Adaptability and flexibility • Cultural sensitivity • Creative problem solver with an open mindset • Demonstrated passion for student learning • Capacity with the English language • Willing to adapt with the school's leave system which must refer to the school academic calendar • Willing to be placed in a remote area Dateline: July 1, 2023

Deskripsi Pekerjaan About The Team GoTo Group has an immediate need for a HSE Supervisor. In this role, you will be part of the GA Team based in Indonesia. Focusing heavily on providing assurance by evaluating and improving the control process. you will employ analytical thinking skills, and communication skills, and be able to adapt to a fast-phase environment in an effort to deliver the audit successfully. In our humble opinion, the coolest part is your ability to be eloquent in delivering communication with stakeholders and have high enthusiasm for learning. What You Will Do • Ensuring, checking, and conducting monthly inspections of the readiness and suitability of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and workplace safety equipment such as fire extinguishers, first aid kits, etc. • Ensuring that safety signs in the workplace are properly installed. • Providing training to workers on the use of PPE, first aid, emergency response, etc. • Monitoring the implementation of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) by all employees. • Developing programs to minimize hazardous waste and ensure proper handling. • Providing hazardous waste containers for each work unit. • Conducting routine inspections of the impact and hazards of the work being carried out. • Conducting monthly HSE (Health, Safety, and Environment) meetings and developing programs for them. • Organizing and leading emergency situation simulations every month so that actual emergencies can be anticipated and addressed. • Receiving monthly reports on inspections. • Conducting daily briefings and instructions for HSE officers and staff. • Disciplining and sanctioning workers who violate established health and safety regulations (K3). • Coordinating safe work permits for each work unit, especially contractors. • Solving problems, conducting investigations, auditing, and providing input for improving safety. What You Will Need • Minimum Bachelor's degree in K3 (Occupational Health and Safety) or Civil Engineering • Experience: Minimum 3 years (Supervisor) in K3 and environmental fields • Age: 27-35 years old • Possesses a General K3 Expert certification (Supervisor) • Understands: • Contractor Safety Management System (CSMS) • OHSAS 18001, ISO 45001, Government Regulation No.50 Year 2012, ISO 9001, ISO 14001 • Occupational Health and Safety and Environmental Laws and Regulations • Techniques for identifying K3 hazards and risk assessment • Environmental aspects and impacts • Emergency response handling, preferably with a certificate in Fire Fighting (Class A) and First Aid • Incident investigation techniques • Understands K3 inspection methods.

We are a global leading supplier in equipment and tools, parts, service and technical solutions for the mining and construction industries. Applications include rock drilling, rock cutting, loading and hauling, tunnelling and quarrying. It’s an exciting time to join Sandvik Mining and Rock Technology. The industry is being revolutionized through digitalization, electrification, and material development – and we’re driving significant shifts, advancing the world through our engineering. We also have our eyes set on sustainability and have ambitious goals in the areas of climate, circularity, people, and Fair Play – this helps us to keep focus on building even more sustainable business. The role We currently have opportunities for qualified technicians to join our team as Maintenance Mechanical Advisors based in the Freeport Indonesia - located in the Papua Province, Indonesia. The opportunity is well suited for those with strong customer-centric and technical support experience for Sandvik underground drill and bolt equipment. You will be a key member of an established team and drive the reliability and availability of the underground mining fleet while supporting a zero-harm safety culture. The opportunity will see you: • Collaborate Workshop Manager for EHS initiatives, training needs, and specific customer requirements • Actively driving the adaption of new technology by Service Personnel including improving process and procedures through digitalization. • Provide on-site technical assistance to resolve issues. • Develop customer relationships to ensure customers have a positive experience and remain loyal to the Sandvik brand. • Provide technical training to the service network on proper operation, maintenance and troubleshooting practices. • Provide technical support to end users, operators, and service personnel in cases of complex technical issues. • Provide relevant feedback to Technical Support Managers and relevant Factory Product Engineering to enable improvements to the equipment or its operation. • Provide assistance in compiling accurate data to process warranty claims and engineering improvements. • Review spare parts recommendations with Parts organization • Commissioning of new machines and submit Strategic Stock Request (SSR) • Investigate warranty claims proactively and reactively to enhance customer satisfaction and provide feedback to the Warranty Analyst. • Review current operating operational practices and make suggestions to improve component turn around times as well as cost reduction measures Your profile To be successful in this position you must be trade qualified or have similar qualifications disciplined in mechanical, electrical and hydraulics systems. You will have extensive experience in a similar role in the underground mining industry with a minimum of seven years’ experience maintaining Sandvik underground drill and bolting equipment. Importantly, you will have a strong understanding of underground drilling and bolting principles and practices combined with deep working knowledge of the Sandvik product range. In addition to your expert technical knowledge, you will have good communication and customer service skills and the ability to build long term relationships. Training experience or qualifications will be looked upon favourably. Our vision of zero-harm for our people, the environment we work in, our customers and our suppliers, is shared by you. What is in it for you? • A globally competitive salary with benefits including site and travel allowances. • All required work permits and visas • Options for roster including 6:2, 8:3 or residential • Versatile and interesting tasks in international business environment, as well as the opportunity to develop your own professional skills and career. • Be part of a global leader that is shaping the future of the Mining Industry in sustainable ways. We have a strong focus on enhancing customer productivity, profitability and sustainability through our unique expertise and solutions for the manufacturing, mining, and infrastructure industries. Our offering covers their value chains and is based on extensive investments in research and development, customer insights and a deep knowledge of industrial processes and digital solutions. We have a long history of ethical and responsible business conduct, which has played a significant role in the global success of our company for 160 years. We conduct business in a sustainable and responsible manner, are committed to creating safe and healthy workplaces and delivering the industry’s safest products and services. We are proud to shape the future of our industry in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal, and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results.

job_title: Agroforestry Developer of aGROWforests Project in Bangka and Lampung
job_description: Background In a world grappling with environmental challenges and the need for sustainable agriculture, the role of agroforestry developers has emerged as crucial. These individuals possess specialized knowledge and expertise in the field of agroforestry, a practice that combines trees, crops, and livestock in a harmonious and integrated manner. They are the driving force behind the planning, design, and implementation of agroforestry systems that bring about a host of benefits for both the environment and communities. Agroforestry developers are not stagnant in their approach. They constantly stay informed about the latest scientific research and technological advancements in the field, collaborating with researchers and scientists to incorporate innovative practices into their projects. Through their commitment to ongoing learning, they ensure that agroforestry remains effective, efficient, and adaptable to changing environmental and socio-economic conditions. Ultimately, agroforestry developers play a vital role in promoting sustainable land management, biodiversity conservation, climate change mitigation and adaptation, economic diversification, food security, and environmental sustainability. With their expertise and passion, they are paving the way for a more resilient and sustainable future, where agricultural systems and ecosystems coexist in harmony, benefiting both the present and future generations. Role and Responsibility The role of an agroforestry developer encompasses a range of responsibilities and tasks to promote and implement agroforestry practices. • Assessing land suitability for agroforestry systems based on factors like soil quality, climate, water availability, and local ecosystems. Conduct site assessments and create plans for optimized resource use and productivity, ensuring environmental sustainability. • Collaborating with the training coordinator, Agroforestry developer will support the organization and implementation of educational programs and training workshops to raise awareness about the benefits of agroforestry. Agroforestry developer will assist in sharing knowledge on agroforestry techniques, ecosystem services, and best practices with farmers, landowners, and community members. Agroforestry developer will involve empowering individuals to adopt and maintain agroforestry systems through capacity-building initiatives, complementing the training efforts organized by the project.. • Involves ensuring that the demonstration plot aligns with the expectations and objectives of the program. • Providing technical expertise and guidance to farmers, landowners, and local communities. Offering advice on agroforestry practices, such as pruning, thinning, and intercropping techniques, to optimize production and environmental benefits and address challenges and provide solutions to ensure successful agroforestry implementation. • Designing agroforestry systems tailored to specific landscapes and objectives. Selecting appropriate tree and shrub species that are compatible with the agricultural crops or livestock being integrated and also oversee the implementation process, which may involve activities such as tree planting, soil preparation, and ongoing management. • Monitoring and evaluating the performance and impact of agroforestry systems. Assessing factors for productivity, biodiversity, soil health, water retention, and economic benefit, and also gathering data to improve and refine agroforestry practices and sharing success stories to inspire further adoption. • Collaborate with government agencies, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), academic institutions, sustainable spices associations, and local communities to establish partnerships in agroforestry initiatives. Participate in workshops or public events to raise awareness on agroforestry especially in spices industry.' Important note: It is important to have a deep understanding of the ecological principles and interactions within agroforestry systems. Stay updated with the latest research and innovations in agroforestry practices to incorporate new knowledge and techniques. The minimum qualification required for the applicant of Agroforestry Developer: • Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field such as agriculture, forestry, agroforestry, environmental science, biology, or sustainable agriculture. • Strong knowledge of agroforestry principles, practices, and techniques. • Experience in designing, implementing, and managing agroforestry systems in Indonesia for minimum 3 years. • Understanding of ecological interactions and sustainable land management practices. • Knowledge of tree and shrub species selection, including their growth characteristics and interactions with crops or livestock. Preferred, familiarity with pepper tree species is highly desirable. • Familiarity with soil conservation, water management, and biodiversity conservation within agroforestry systems. • Strong analytical skills to assess land suitability and identify appropriate agroforestry interventions. • Excellent communication skills in Bahasa Indonesia and English to collaborate with farmers, landowners, and local communities, and provide training and technical guidance. • Proficiency in data collection, monitoring, and evaluation of agroforestry systems. • Familiarity with agroforestry tools such as GIS, LiDAR, and gap light analysis (GLAMA) will be added values. Process Timeline Application Submission Jun 23, 2023 – Jul 14, 2023 Candidate Interview Jul 17, 2023 - Jul 19, 2023 Announcement Jul 20, 2023 Start Jul 24, 2023 Send the application documents and CV to our recruitment email at agrowforest@cinquer.id. Add 'Agroforestry Developer Application' as the subject of the email. If you have any questions or need further information about the position or the application process, contact us at the same email address or call our office at (+6222) 87319273.

job_title: Senior Analyst Climate and Energy, Indonesia
job_description: Join Ember's fast-growing, global team as Indonesia embarks on its journey towards its net-zero target. This role is essential in supporting Ember’s work on establishing an understanding of methane emissions from coal mining in Indonesia and the opportunities for reducing these to support Indonesia’s commitments under the Global Methane Pledge. We’re committed to providing a great place to work at a competitive salary. We invest in our staff, offer flexible working conditions and pride ourselves on being an open and collaborative workplace. We’re a friendly and supportive team, and all passionately committed to addressing the climate crisis. A significant barrier to Indonesia’s transition to clean power is high dependence on fossil fuels for electricity generation, wherein coal is the highest contributor. This means that the coal industry plays a critical role in both the energy and climate challenge. Coal mining is the largest source of methane emissions in Indonesia, but these emissions remain unmonitored. Methane is the 2nd biggest contributor to global warming with shorter atmospheric lifetime but stronger potency and warming potential. This Coal Mine Methane (CMM) is set to grow significantly, unless, of course, intervened. As highlighted by the IPCC and IEA, addressing Coal Mine Methane is also one of the most cost-effective emissions reduction strategies in the short term. Ember has already made a major international impact in drawing attention to the methane crisis in Australia and the European Union. Please read more about our work here: https://ember-climate.org/topics/coal-mine-methane Ember sees an opportunity in Indonesia to utilize our approach to critical data analysis to evaluate the impact of coal mine methane and reduce the climate impact of the coal sector. Indonesia is increasing coal production, but we see significant opportunity to make progress in Indonesia, as a signatory to the Global Methane Pledge. There is a crucial window to shine the light on the issue and the opportunities to abate these emissions, especially as technology already exists to do so. Ember is looking for a passionate Senior Analyst to lead Ember's Coal Mine Methane (CMM) activities in Indonesia, with support from our existing CMM team based in Europe, Australia and India. To apply you do not need specific expertise in mining or coal mine methane, but a broad understanding of the climate and energy landscape and an appetite to work with many different stakeholders. The successful candidate will have: • Adequate capacity to research and source national data on methane emissions to support our efforts to reduce emissions in Indonesia A deep understanding of climate and energy topics • A good sense of the related developments in the country • A strong network in government and may also have relationships with international and Indonesian NGOs Location This is a remote post, but you would need to be based in Indonesia, ideally in the Greater Jakarta area (Jakarta, Bogor, Depok, Tangerang, Bekasi.) Occasional travel within Indonesia might also be necessary. Key responsibilities • Lead Ember’s research on Indonesia’s coal mine methane (CMM) emissions to better understand the challenges and opportunities • Gather data that can be analysed and used to tell a story of the significance of methane in Indonesia’s coal mining sector • Use data and research to write op-eds and reports that grab attention with the right players • Collaborate with Ember’s existing team in Indonesia and build relationships with research institutes, think tanks and government organisations • Lead on developing a strategy for how to raise the priority of CMM and how to realise the opportunities in improving the monitoring and capture of CMM. • Align our CMM work with the wider energy transition in Indonesia • Brief government and NGO contacts on CMM opportunities and lead workshops/webinars and panel discussions to improve awareness • Use understanding of the policy landscape to identify opportunities and tipping points where we might shift the narrative and have an impact on CMM Requirements We are especially keen to encourage applications from people underrepresented in climate change analysis and campaigning. Climate change is a race issue, a class issue, and a gender issue. We welcome applicants with lived experiences of these issues. Must have • Ability to research and source coal mining emissions data and curate datasets • Minimum five (5) years working in relevant senior research, analyst or policy positions for a climate think tank, NGO, academia or private sector organisation working in Indonesia (background in the mining industry also welcomed); • An effective networker with an established network in Indonesia’s energy and coal space and contacts in relevant government organisations • Knowledge of the coal sector in Indonesia and where this fits with climate, energy and environmental politics and experience in developing strategies to influence policy • Able to work independently and effectively in both spoken and written English and Indonesian, such as writing articles and reports without supervision and attending meetings with Indonesian government officials. • Passionate about reducing global greenhouse gas emissions • Confident working remotely with a broad range of people, from different countries and timezones. Nice to have • Experience of working with anthropogenic methane emissions (coal, oil, gas, agriculture, biogas…) • Experience of developing policy or campaigning in the policy field • Experience liaising with key government ministries and agencies in Indonesia, such as Ministry of Environment and Forestry (KLHK), Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (Kemen ESDM), Ministry of National Development Planning (Bappenas), and/or National Energy Council (DEN) • Experience liaising with private sector, particularly coal companies • Communications/outreach experience to communicate complex ideas succinctly and to influence climate narratives • Fascination with data and data visualisation Benefits Salary: Competitive Contract: Full time (but only working 9 days every fortnight with no reduction in pay), permanent subject to a 3 month probationary period. Further benefits: We offer a competitive benefits package, including: • We operate a nine-day fortnight meaning our full-time staff are given every other Friday off work with no reduction in pay • 25 days holiday, plus UK bank holidays (unless local statutory minimums are higher) • For each year that you're part of the team at Ember you'll receive an additional day of holiday, up to a maximum of 5 additional days. • Generous paid maternity and paternity leave • Flexible working conditions, including the opportunity for part-time work and home working. • Access to a counselling service • Funding and allocated time for your training and development • Paid volunteer day • Two paid days off to enable low carbon travel • Season Ticket loan

job_title: Senior Reservoir Engineer - Reservoir Technical Services
job_description: Senior Reservoir Engineer Do you enjoy creating innovative and strategic solutions to solve complex problems? Would you like participate in the application of scientific and engineering methodologies Join our cutting-edge Reservoir Technical Services team We are the leader in well construction and production. Our innovative physical and digital solutions improve efficiency, production and maximize reservoir value. Our Geo-services team provides support to multiple product lines within our organization. We collaborate with internal cross-functional teams and customers to provide services from exploration through to production. Take ownership for industry leading projects As a Senior Reservoir Engineer, you’ll provide production technology input to multi-disciplinary projects, from frontier exploration through discovery appraisal to field development and production. This role will do hands-on work of production related analysis for integrated subsurface studies from wellbore-scale into field-scale, technical and coaching presentations, generate reports, and some business development involvement. Performs discipline-specific interpretation and analysis using appropriate, state-of-the-art techniques to provide Best In Class solutions for the client. As a Senior Reservoir Engineer, you will be responsible for: Providing technology consultancy services to the client and the product line teams in the areas of Completions, Production Optimization, Fraccing, Well testing, artificial lift systems, sand control, and other production apparent technologies. Showing ability to advise clients on petroleum engineering/production technology matters and provides solutions with excellent written and verbal communication skills. Being highly motivated with excellent analytical and interpersonal skills, be action oriented, ethical in value, and have a strong client focus. Showing good project management skills and being able to work both independently and as part of multi-disciplined teams working with an extensive client base. Conducting Technical presentation and generate reports. Represents the company in outside technical forums, Publishes technical reports and papers for internal and external use Fuel your passion To be successful in this role you will: Have a Bachelor's degree in Petroleum Engineering, Geology or Earth Sciences with a minimum of 10+ years of relevant experience. Have demonstrate effective communication, interpersonal and leadership skills with the ability to mentor others. Show familiarity with Production technology software including PETEX, Netool, OLGA, WellCat, ScaleChem, Kappa etc. Have experience in end-to-end contract and commercial management for products, services, and projects. Be able to travel at short notice to potentially global locations (around 30% of the time). Be a good team player and display good communication skills. Work in a way that works for you We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns: Flexibility within the day or week to get the job done About Us: We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Let’s come together and take energy forward. Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

job_title: Ethics & Compliance - Head of Internal Investigations
job_description: HoldCo - Risk Management, Jakarta About the Role You will be part of the Ethics and Compliance (E&C) Team based in Jakarta, supporting business units operating there (i.e. Gojek, GoToFinance, and Tokopedia). We protect the company's reputation and manage risks related to the GoTo ecosystem that meet regulatory and shareholders' expectations. The E&C team is focused on the regulatory and corporate policy compliance defined within our Code of Conduct. Focusing on executing the internal investigations on a timely basis, in a confidential and professional manner, while working with cross-functional stakeholders. This role works on completing the root causes of the breaches and analyzing what needs improvement, working closely with the Internal Controls & Monitoring team. What You Will Do • Carry out the vision and mission of Fraud & Investigations to prevent, detect, and investigate issues of fraud and financial abuse within the company. Promote a zero-tolerance control environment where fraud or noncompliance is unacceptable and difficult to conceal. • Demonstrate proven ability to work with senior stakeholders, strong investigations competency, and forensic discipline whilst exercising strong leadership and motivating and developing staff with a positive organizational culture. • Manage escalations, including triage, prioritization, allocation, investigation, and report-out with senior leadership. • Lead an Investigation Governance Team made up of various internal investigation teams from People & Culture (PAC), Cyber Incident Response Security Team (CIRST), and Workplace Management (WPM), with assistance from Data Privacy Officer and Legal, to drive consistency in the investigation process and oversight on all internal investigation cases for reporting and tracking purposes. • Intake of confidential complaints and whistleblower reports, including initial witness interviews; risk diagnoses; and memorialization of necessary date, topic, and personnel information in a clear, organized, up-to-date manner. • Use a variety of diagnostic and forensic technology techniques to help determine key areas of risk and assess how well that risk is managed. Identify, obtain and analyze financial, operational, and other data relevant to the investigation of allegations of misconduct and the assessment of enterprise risks. Prepare work papers to adequately document investigations performed with supporting evidence for all forensic findings. • Manage case management, updating, and maintaining databases and tracking sheets or case management tools chronicling open investigations, updates, and next steps; labeling and storing documents, data, and other materials obtained during investigations; and scheduling and planning witness interviews. • Drive data analytics and due diligence for internal investigations purposes, including identifying, requesting, obtaining, reviewing, analyzing, and describing complex financial and operational data; identifying patterns, anomalies, and “red flags;” and creating powerful visuals and graphics for reports and presentations. What You Will Need • Minimum 10 years of relevant experience in investigations, forensic, law enforcement, and risk and fraud risk assessment experience • Possess excellent analytical, written, and oral communications skills, including the ability to synthesize, summarize and communicate important data in an objective and unbiased manner • Strong leadership and analytical skills, and ability to work independently and in a team environment. Demonstrated ability to effectively drive collaboration • Excellent discretion, respect for confidentiality, and attention to detail. • Strong background in intelligence gathering, including familiarity and use of online resources, subscription services, public record checks, and familiarity with current social media and its usage. Proven research, audit, and/or investigation experience, including root cause analysis. • Expertise in Word, Excel and PowerPoint and experience with data mining software such as ACL, Access, SQL, Business Objects, etc. preferred. • Must be able to deal effectively with people at all levels of internal and external organizations About the Team The GoTo Ethics and Compliance team reports to the Chief of Risk Officer. Our team’s mission is to ensure that ethical behavior is at the heart of all business activities, through the strong tone at the top and risk-based approach for our corporate compliance program. As an Ethics and Compliance in GoTo, one gets a unique opportunity to gain exposure to other GoTo operating companies group and across operating locations (ie. Indonesia, Singapore, Vietnam, and India). This is an exciting time to join our family, as we are in the phase of shaping the Ethics & Compliance culture and program at GoTo. Our top two priorities for the coming year include redrafting several policies and procedures to simplify them from a risk-based approach and implementing a compliance governance tool to help standardize our internal processes to help us scale our activities across GoTo. As a team, we are concerned not only with the growth of the company, but also with your personal growth professionally and your well-being, where we invest in your continuous learning and offer a hybrid working arrangement. About GoTo Group GoTo Group is the largest digital ecosystem in Indonesia with its mission to “Empower Progress’ by offering technological infrastructure and solutions for everyone to access and thrive in the digital economy. The GoTo ecosystem consists of on-demand transportation services, e-commerce, food and grocery delivery, logistics and fulfillment, as well as financial and payment services through the Gojek, Tokopedia and GoTo Financial platforms.It is the first platform in Southeast Asia that hosts these crucial cases in a single ecosystem, capturing the majority of Indonesia’s vast consumer household. About Gojek Gojek is Southeast Asia’s leading on-demand platform and pioneer of the multi-service ecosystem with over 2.5 million driver partners across the regions offering a wide range of services such as transportation, food delivery, logistics and more. With its mission to create impact at scale, Gojek is committed to resolving consumer problems and raising standards of living by connecting consumers to the best providers of goods and services in the market. About GoTo Financial GoTo Financial accelerates financial inclusion through its leading financial services and merchants solutions. Its consumer services include GoPay and GoPayLater and serve businesses of all sizes through Midtrans, Moka, GoBiz Plus, GoBiz, and Selly. With its trusted and inclusive ecosystem of products, GoTo Financial is open to new growth opportunities and aims to empower everyone to Make It Happen, Make It Together, Make It Last. About Tokopedia Tokopedia is an Indonesian technology company with a mission to democratize commerce through technology. It has been a driving force behind Indonesia's digital development since its foundation in 2009, with more than 99% of districts and empowered around 12 million merchants listed nationwide. With Nakama ranging all across Indonesia, Tokopedia aims to simplify the lives of many to #FindYourPurpose together.

JOB TITLE: Senior Construction Manager KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Oversight the assigned Site Teams for the execution of awarded projects to Petrofac safety and quality standards, within scheduled time of completion, contractual limits, budgeted costs and to Clients’ satisfaction. Assure that the required Petrofac and Client policies, manuals, procedures and work processes for Construction Operations are implemented. Establish a good and transparent relation with Client site representative. Ensure that appropriate licenses, permissions prior to start of site preparation, set up infrastructure facilities and mobilization of manpower at Site. Review the Project & Construction scope, Construction BOQs, Project execution plan and assess the schedule and finalize the construction deliverables such as Construction Execution Plan, Subcontracting Strategy, Construction Management Team Organization, Construction Manpower Mobilization plan, Site set-up checklist etc. Guide development of detailed construction planning by interfacing with Project Controls Manager and providing inputs on WBS, activities definition, sequencing, durations and resource estimate. Review and approve Responsibility Matrix of all subcontractors and support cost estimates. Identify early work plan at construction site such as survey, setting up pioneer camp etc. and initiate action. Participate in project plot plan review, constructability / path of construction reviews, risk reviews. Involved in management site walks and conduct detailed evaluations of site conditions and surrounding facilities (including roads, site access, fencing, obstructions, parking, railroads and transportation facilities, weather, soil, security, utilities, and environmental restrictions and conditions) Promote the Project Production Control (PPC) daily progress monitoring approach with the team and subcontractors. Ensure that an audit/assessment is carried out on Subcontractors machinery/operator by a competent HSSE personnel. Monitor Subcontractor’s performance & attend / review progress reports. Establish a good relationship with Subcontractor’s site manager. Implement CER Recommendations Authorize local purchase and approve local subcontractors with consent of the Project Director. Study in detail Subcontract Agreement and be aware of all Ts & Cs and project specifications. Support Contracts department in the negotiation terms of agreements. Organize Subcontract / cost awareness sessions with site team personnel regarding the commercial impact of the decisions made by them on site. Identify site related risks, their probability and consequences through a structured process. Put in place contingency / mitigation plan for high risk & high probability activities. Implement Go/No-go checklist for critical activities (as applicable). Encourage and train construction resources to build Quality in Construction (Right First-Time approach). Ensure quality construction standards are followed and use of appropriate construction techniques. Update the mob/demob master list on monthly basis and submit to Resourcing Team. Interface with client, partners and sub-contractors to obtain common understanding of key objectives and means of achieving these while recognizing inherent obligation of all parties. Interface with executive management for effective and efficient reporting. Oversee that annual and demob appraisals are completed fairly by appropriate superintendents/supervisors, and results submitted. Look after career development of his subordinates and provide necessary feedback at regular intervals. Implement applicable Lessons Learned from previous projects. Encourage site team to submit Construction Observation Forms. Assess and approves Construction Observations raised by site team. Arrange adequate trainings for site supervision. Develop and expose Petrofac construction engineers to multidiscipline activities. Member of the VoC (Verification of Competency) committee and accountable for verifying competencies of resources engaged in critical activities (rigging & Lifting, scaffolding, piping and electrical). Maintain openness and transparency at site between all parties. Attend Construction forums when requested by the Head of Department. Support in preparation of technical and financial elements for construction activities during the bid proposal phase as requested by the Head of Department. ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS: • 20+ experience in direct hire construction with an international E&C company. • 20+ Experience in the oil & gas industry. • Relevant degree or diploma from an accredited college or university. Preference will be given to candidates who meet the following criteria: • Experience working in the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS/FSU), Middle East, and/or North Africa. • Prior experience working with a diverse international workforce. • Experience in managing of Cost Reimbursable / Unit rate structured contracts. #LI-BS1
